column1: back of a length outside off, gets on his toes to punch to backward point
back of a length, nips back in towards Rohit's front hip. Can't connect with the flick and he's hit on the body
and again, a bit of inward movement from just back of a length. Misses the flick and he's hit on the thigh pad. The release looked like he was trying the legcutter, but it went the other way
full outside off, gets a good stride forward to push to wide mid-off/extra cover
in the blockhole on off stump, defended to that man at extra-cover. There's no orthodox mid-off
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
back of a length, hurries onto the batsman on an off-stump line, defended back to the bowler
shortish outside off, the speedgun says 124.3kph but it's surely quicker than that. Chopped to extra-cover

misjudgment from Gill, and Stone has a wicket in his first over of Test cricket in India! No hesitation from Nitin Menon, and Gill doesn't review either. Good-length ball, nipping in from not too far outside off, and Gill fatally shoulders arms. The ball hits him on the front pad, on the knee roll, and there's little chance of it missing the stumps from there. Hitting the top of off according to ball-tracking
fullish, angling into off stump, defended towards mid-on
full, angling into middle stump, shows the full face and blocks to mid-on
length ball outside off, left alone
shot. Not a half-volley, but full enough outside off for Rohit to get a stride forward and drive with the full face through the covers
back of a length, angling into leg stump, tucked away into the backward square leg region
fullish, close to off stump, defended into the cover region
length ball on middle stump, clipped towards midwicket
full, angling into off stump, defended to mid-on

full, close to off stump, not much of a stride forward to defend, but soft hands as you'd expect. The ball straightens, finds the edge, but drops well short of the cordon and scoots away to the right of the diving second slip fielder
full, close to off stump, driven firmly back and Stone gets a bit of his foot to it to slow it down, allowing mid-off to stop it. It was going for four if he didn't make that half-interception
length ball, not far outside off, Pujara watches it closely and leaves it alone
length ball close to off stump, defended into the cover region
excellent short ball, rising steeply over off stump, left alone, swaying his upper body away from the line. Speedgun says 142.3kph this time
full on middle stump, clipped to mid-on
length ball in the corridor, good stride forward and a good leave. 143kph
length ball on off stump, defended to extra-cover
full outside off, and that's nicely timed by Rohit. No real footwork, but it's full enough for him to reach out with his hands and play a checked drive into the point region
length ball, top of off, defended to wide mid-off/straight extra-cover

length ball in the corridor, and Rohit is unsure whether to play or leave. Makes the late decision to leave, and the ball hits his inside edge as he lifts his bat up, and bounces towards the keeper. Could easily have gone back onto his stumps
shot. Similar line, but a touch too full, and Rohit simply shows the full face and drives between the bowler and mid-off
length ball outside off, looks like the attempted offcutter. Stays a little low as Rohit leaves it, but it's well outside off
length ball on of stump, defended back towards the bowler. 141.9kph
full, but fairly wide outside off, left alone. 141.5kph

ooh, skiddy again. Back of a length at 138kph, and the ball nips back in a little as Pujara looks to fend it away, hits him somewhere on the body and rolls into the point region. Looks like it may have hit his right hand, actually
full on off stump, defended to extra-cover
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball on off stump, defended to midwicket
full outside off, gets forward for a checked push to the left of mid-off
length ball angling into middle and leg, deftly manoeuvres his bat face to glance it down to long leg
length ball, fourth-stump line, gets right behind it to defend into the covers

big appeal for lbw as Rohit plays around his front pad to try and clip into the leg side. It's an issue in his technique, because of that short front-and-across stride. A bit of inward movement, but there's an inside edge on this occasion
length ball outside off, defended into the covers

wow. That's full on off stump, and it stops on Rohit a bit as he comes forward to drive. Checks his shot, and ends up playing what looks like a half-deliberate chip that flies quickly over mid-on. Somehow managed to time that like a dream

length ball in the corridor, and the ball stops again and straightens. Pujara is initially looking to defend, then he pulls his bat away from the line and lets himself be beaten. Or it looks like that, and he's been genuinely beaten. Didn't let his hands get drawn away from him by the movement, though
back of a length, angling into the stumps, lets it come on and tucks it gently into the square leg region. Just a defensive pat with a slightly closed face
length ball on middle stump, clipped to the right of midwicket
short and wide, and he stands tall and cuts it away fiercely to the right of the diving gully fielder. May have ended up going a little finer than he intended, but he hit that hard and kept it down
a bit of inward shape in towards off stump, on a length. Jams his bat down just in time to block it back to the bowler, keeping his front pad out of the way
again short outside off, but this time the ball stops on Rohit, and he has to abort his attempted cut and play what ends up as a horizontal-bat defensive jab to mid-on
tossed up slow outside off, definite turn there, and Pujara pushes it into the cover point region with an open face. Bounce too - it hit the sticker of his bat

quick length ball on middle and leg and Rohit defends into the on side. Again his front pad went towards the leg side as he came forward, much like his footwork when he got bowled in the second innings of the first Test

sliding down leg this time, and Rohit stretches out to try and lap it fine. Decent lbw appeal, but it isn't given. England have a long thing, and decide to review... Seems to slide past the inside edge or brush it on the way to hitting the pad. No, it's missed the edge. sliding down leg this time, and Rohit stretches out to try and lap it fine. Decent lbw appeal, but it isn't given. England have a long thing, and decide to review... pitching just in line with leg stump, but it doesn't straighten enough, keeps going with the angle and strikes his thigh pad outside leg stump. England lose a review
full on middle stump, driven down to long-off. Not a bad position against Rohit, even this early in his innings
quick length ball turning away from off stump, half press forward to defend with the turn, into the covers
tossed up slower now, off-stumpish line, stretches out a little more to defend down the pitch
overpitched outside off, nice stride forward to drive with an open face through point
length ball outside off, opens his bat face again and steers towards gully
length ball, closer to off stump, punched to cover

back of a length on leg stump, tucked into the square leg region, and Moeen has to run in quite a distance from the boundary. Pujara wants the second, but Rohit sends him back. Good decision because the fielder made up ground quickly
back of a length outside off, defended into the point region
length ball outside off, left alone
tossed up full on middle stump, gets his front leg out of the way and drive to long-off
down the track to the flighted ball on leg stump, clips to midwicket
a touch short, spinning away from middle and off, rocks back, makes room, and cuts to backward point
nicely flighted on middle and off, defended towards midwicket
length ball straightening a touch towards middle stump, gets forward and blocks it back towards the bowler
tossed up a bit fuller, similar line, defended towards mid-on
back of a length outside off, punched towards the fielder at cover

wham. Short, angling into middle and leg, and it sits up to be pulled. May have actually stopped on Rohit a little too. Goes after it despite there being a deep square leg in place, and he gets it into the gap to the left of the fielder. Just clears the rope
short again, gets up to waist high just around off stump, and this time he can roll his wrists over the ball and find the gap to the right of deep square leg
length ball angling into middle and off, gets across to clip this to the left of long leg
length ball on off stump, straightens a touch, shows the full face to defend into the on side
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers
flighted and outside off, no turn, Rohit stays leg-side of the line and drives smoothly to short cover
darted in on off, Rohit gets forward and guides it to short cover once again
drifts in from around the wicket, full on off, played back to Leach

edged and did that carry to Stokes lunging forward from slip? Think it bounced in front of Stokes. Full, drifts in towards off stump, then turns and bounces to kiss the outside edge as Rohit presses forward in defence, but it doesn't go into the hands of Stokes
flighted and outside off, blocked
tossed up on off, defended off the front foot
Pujara dashes out first ball to Moeen and drills a full-toss back to him
Pujara steps out once again, meets a full ball outside off early and drives firmly to the left of mid-off
pushed through on off, forward and blocked into the leg side
floated up outside off, now it's Rohit's turn to use his feet and secure a single down the ground, to long-on, bringing up the half-century stand
Pujara forays down the pitch again, the bat gets stuck behind his front pad as he aims to defend. The ball hits that front pad and rolls away
down the track and bunted down to long-on
Pujara steps out once again, driving a single to the left of mid-off

Leach goes wide of the crease, pushed through on off, Rohit stretches out for the sweep, meets it on the full, and smacks it to the left of the short-leg fielder and the leg umpire. Pinged away to the square-leg boundary
dangled up on middle, Rohit deploys a big stride and plays it back to Leach
and again. Rohit brings up a 47-ball half-century! Rohit stretches out once again, takes another delivery on the full, and sweeps flat and hard to the square boundary. Rohit 50. India 60 for 1
down the track and jabbed back to the left of Leach
good length and drifts in at middle, blocked with soft hands, ensuring it does not carry to short leg
on a length and seems to drift away outside off, Pujara goes back and taps it to point
here comes Pujara: down the track once again, whipped with the wrists to the left of short leg, finding the gap at square leg
Pujara uses his feet once again, Moeen has dragged his length back, finding drift once again. Off the pad and loops to Stokes at slip
Pujara continues to use his feet, hides his bat behind the front pad. The ball hits his thigh and loops to where silly-point may have been
defensively worked to the leg side with the spin
pretty full on middle, Pujara meets it early by using his feet and then clipping it straight to short midwicket
wide of the crease, Leach held this one back. Rohit shimmies out, checks his drive, and almost spoons a return catch
speared into off, even fuller, played back to Leach

Leach belts out an appeal for leg-before. Not given. Stokes at first slip gesticulates that the impact may have been outside the line of off. Pushed through on off, Rohit presses forward and is struck on the front pad. Okay, the tracker returns umpire's call on impact and suggests it would have bounced over the stumps as well
on a length and outside off, Rohit delays the sweep and gets it finer on the leg side
flatter and quicker on the stumps, defended
dropped short and wide outside off, spins away further, Pujara goes right back and rifles a cut wide of backward point. Burns, I think, chases hard and keeps it to a double
edged, but doesn't carry to Stokes once again at slip. Moeen gets it to slide on from over the wicket, Rohit searches for it and nicks it off to the left of Stokes
down the track and whipped firmly between square leg and short midwicket
Moeen shortens his length and gets it to drift away outside off, Pujara jabs it to short cover
Pujara uses his feet once again, this time picking off a single to the right of midwicket
now it's Rohit's turn to step out and dead-bat a drifter from Moeen
short, wide, Rohit latches onto it and crunnnnnnches it behind point. Cut away to the right of slip for his 10th boundary
tossed outside off, down the track and eased through the line to mid-off
tap and run into the covers
sliding in, quicker and bounces, draws an inside edge which rolls away past the right of short leg
on a length and spins away outside off, left alone in the channel
wide of the crease, sliding into middle, dead-batted away
wide of the crease, slightly shorter and on the pads, tucked away, but short fine leg hunts the ball down
nudged with the spin to the right of short midwicket
on a length and drifts away outside off, Pujara skips out, hides his bat behind the front pad, and kicks it away
Pujara jumps out, Moeen drags his length back and hits the thigh pad
down the track and punched to the left of short midwicket and right of mid-on
shorter and spins away outside off. Moeen errs with his length and Rohit punishes him. He jumps right back, opens the face, and punches it to the right of slip as the ball whistles away behind point
down the track and forced down to long-on
too full and outside off, Rohit drives sweetly to the left of mid-off hanging back

edged and third-time lucky for Stokes. This loops into his hands at slip. Leach tosses it up outside off and finds turn, Pujara jabs at it slightly away from his body, probably aiming to steer it down to third man past slip, but he can only nick it off
slider outside off, left alone
sliding into middle, Kohli bends forward in defence
fired on middle, defended
non-turner on middle, tapped down to mid-on
tossed outside off, Rohit stretches out and drives it down to long-on

wow, Moeen has knocked over Kohli for a duck. The India captain hangs around. He can't believe what has just happened! Moeen tosses it up, finds drift outside off, then it rips back in so very sharply to hit the top of off. This offbreak dips sharply as well, creating distance between the bat and the pitch of the ball, making Kohli's attempt to drive through the covers look a whole lot worse. Moeen just burst through the gate and silenced Chepauk
full-toss outside off, Rahane leans into it and caresses it away to the left of extra-cover
pushed through on off, defended quietly to the left of silly-point
down the track and whipped to short midwicket
danged up on off, Rahane stretches out to smother it
pushed back to the bowler
Rohit skips out and drives a length ball from outside off to short cover
speared into leg stump, Rohit gets his front leg out of the way and drives it to mid-off
tossed around off, blocked off the front foot
a touch too full and straight, driven to the right of mid-on
on a length and skidding in on middle, negotiated off the back foot
flighted and drifts away outside off, poked towards point off the outer half
hauled away to the midwicket boundary. Tossed up wide of off, Rohit stretches out, rolls his wrists, and sweeps fiercely to the leg-side fence
full and drifts away outside off, driven through the line to deep cover
whipped away to the right of midwicket
on a length outside off, drifts away further, Rahane is happy to kick it away with his pad
floated up and spins in, Rahane presses forward and defends it
on a length and Leach finds quick turn outside off, Rohit shoulders arms
Rohit uses his feet and blocks a length ball back to Leach
sweet as. Rohit shows the full face of the ball and regally drives it to the right of Leach. Slightly overpitched on middle, eased between the bowler and Rahane
Rohit opens the face and guides it square through the off side
fuller and slides in at off, Rohit lunges forward and blocks it to the right of the bowler
on a length and outside off, left alone
chipped in the air...but to the right of a diving Pope at backward short leg. On a length and homing into the body, fended away in the air

edged, Stone snags the outside edge, but Rohit threads the cordon, and the ball runs away to the fence. Full, angling in towards off, then straightening to take the outside edge and streak away between slips and gully
short and outside off, Rohit drags a pull to deep midwicket
back of a length and slanting in at the top of off, played back to the bowler
on a length and skidding in at 140.3ks to hit Rahane on the thigh
Stone cranks it up to 148ks, but Rahane manages to sway his upper body out of the way and ignores this lifter outside off
tossed up quite full on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
length ball, a little wider outside off, left alone
another leave against a wide-ish length ball, interesting technique from Ben Foakes, he's not crouching fully behind the stumps even to the spinners
length ball, a bit closer to off stump, defended into the point region
tossed up outside off, lands on a nice length and straightens with extra bounce and a bit of an explosion off the surface. Left alone
tossed up fuller, driven watchfully into the point region
full on off stump, gets forward for a smooth drive to mid-off
ooh, well stopped. Full, angling into off stump, and he clips it crisply but Root throws himself to his left at leg gully to stop it
length ball outside off, defended into the cover point region
ooh, again Rahane looks to work a fullish ball into the leg side from an off-stump line. Closes his face too early and the leading edge pops up into the cover region
full on off stump, driven down the ground and the man at extra-cover/wide mid-off dives right to stop it

back of a length in the corridor, and Rahane looks to stand tall and punch into the covers. Ball stops on him, and he gets a thick inside edge into the pitch. Rahane likes the ball coming onto the bat, so this pitch will test him.
flat and quite full on off stump, good stride forward to get close to the pitch of the ball and smother the spin
steps out to defend a flighted ball on leg stump, and the ball hits his front pad before his bat. Not the loudest lbw appeal, not sure it straightened enough to be hitting the stumps
more confident appeal this time as Rohit looks to sweep from outside off. The ball kept going with the angle, but the impact was outside off
lovely flight on a middle-and-off line, clipped back towards the bowler

down the track, and that's a brave shot from Rohit. Tosses it wider to invite him to take on the fielder at long-off, and Rohit goes through with it, doesn't quite middle it, but places it to the left of the fielder
quick length ball pitching on middle and turning towards off, defended into the on side, decent stride forward
back of a length outside off, left alone
full, angling down leg, has to play around his front pad to flick it, and he misses
short, only gets up to waist height on leg stump, pulled to long leg
back of a length, a bit of shape in towards off stump, nicely behind it to defend back to the bowler
fuller now, on off stump, defended to mid-on. This is a good line
short and wide, the shot was on, but Rohit fails to get his feet moving back and across for the cut, ends up slashing and missing. The ball seemed to curl away just a bit too
quick flight and dip on an off-stump line, presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
full on leg stump, clipped to the left of backward square leg
quick length ball close to off stump, punched to short cover
floated up, ends up as a low full-toss on off stump, jabbed to short extra-cover
nicely flighted on off stump, gets that front pad away from the line again to block it back to Leach
skips out to the tossed-up ball on off stump, drives watchfully to mid-off. Not sure when he came in off the boundary for Rohit
back of a length on off stump, a bit of extra bounce. Drops his bottom hand in order to keep it down into the leg side. Hits the handle of the bat and drops well short of leg gully
back of a length outside off, and that's a classic Rahane shot. Plays it so well, standing tall, letting it come to him, and punching crisply through cover point
back of a length close to off stump, gets on his toes and defends  into the covers
shot! Full, just outside off, and he transfers his weight forward and the perfect time to flow into a drive to the left of wide mid-off. Slightly overpitched, but what a shot nonetheless
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
in the blockhole close to off stump, defended square on the off side
full on off stump, maybe drifted in a bit. Punched firmly back to the bowler
full on off stump, clipped to mid-on. Rahane hares out of his crease at the other end and Rohit hurriedly, and rightly, sends him back
nicely flighted on an off-stumpish line, gets his head over the ball to defend into the off side, front pad away from the line
tossed up full outside off, gets forward for a push to deep point
a touch short, extra bounce on an off-stump line, rises to his full height to punch towards backward point
flat one skids on towards middle stump, goes right back to punch it back to the bowler
tossed up full outside off, gets forward to clip to midwicket
a bit quicker, similar line, gets forward and blocks it back to the bowler
tossed up full outside off, driven to long-on

nicely flighted outside off, dips a little as Rahane looks to whip this through the on side. He may have wanted to hit through midwicket or mid-on, ends up playing it to deep backward square leg off the inside half of his bat
nice stretch out to defend this one into the on side, with the turn from outside off
shot. Picks up the length well outside off, and stretches out to sweep firmly, in the air but to the left of deep square leg
full on middle and off, whipped to mid-on
ooh, skids on with the arm towards off stump, but just about short enough for Rahane to be able to make room and adjust and defend into the covers. Nimble footwork there
superb delivery. Dips onto a beautiful length close to off stump, brings Rahane forward to defend and then rips it past his outside edge
big stretch out this time, the ball is slightly fuller too, around that off-stump line. Smothers the spin very well
flat skidder on middle stump, goes right back to clip to the right of midwicket
flighted ball on an off-stump line, skips out and blocks it back to the bowler
ooh, not far enough forward to this dipping offbreak spinning sharply from off stump. Past the inside edge and hits the pad, but it's turning too much to hit the stumps
fuller, defended back to the bowler
goes right back to one spinning in from outside off, defends it back down the pitch
tossed up on off stump, gets into a good position to sweep to deep square leg
tossed up on middle stump, steps out and clips to long-on
tossed up outside off, gets forward to defend. A bit of dip and turn, and the ball hits the inside half of the bat and rolls into the leg side
quick length ball outside off, left alone
down the track to the flighted ball on off stump, gets close enough to it to play against the turn and clip to the right of mid-on
full on off stump, defended into the off side, with the turn
flighted ball, slightly wide of off stump, left alone
shot. Just a touch short, spinning away outside off, but it's slow turn, and Rahane goes right back to whip it wristily into the square leg region
goes right back to this one, straightening towards middle stump, to work it through square leg
tossed up full, close to off stump, defended to midwicket
down the track, meets this loopy ball on the full and clips it back to the bowler
tossed up close to off stump, skips out and clips to short mid-on

nicely flighted, a bit of dip and bounce from outside off, big stretch out to defend, and the ball is past his outside edge to hit his pad. No appeal, though, because it probably struck him outside the line

bam. Tossed up wide of off stump, and that only gives Rohit ample room to free his arms, so long as he can get close to the pitch of the ball. He does that with his footwork, and it's hit hard and flat over the long-off boundary
tossed up outside off, good stride forward to defend
fullish, close to off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length on off stump, right behind it to defend towards short extra-cover
length ball close to off stump, blocked to short extra-cover
full now, outside off, and Rahane plays a sliced drive with an open face to the right of gully. Quite deliberate
full, almost in the blockhole on off stump, clipped to short mid-on
length ball outside off, left alone
tossed up full on off stump, clipped to short leg
ooh, doesn't quite get to the pitch. Jumps out, looks to drive away from his body, and the ball dips, grips and turns to hit the inside half of his bat and go to midwicket

nervy times as he nears his hundred. Looks for the lap sweep from outside off, the ball stops on him, and pops up towards short midwicket off the cue end of the bat. He's lucky that falls short of the fielder
fuller now, outside off, defended into the point region
full-toss on the stumps, whipped firmly down the ground but short mid-on is in place to stop it with a dive to his left
down the track, gets close to the pitch of this off-stump ball, and clips it down to long-on to pick up one and keep the strike
length ball on off stump, stays on the back foot and defends right under his eyes

ooh, another loose shot as the hundred nears. Back of a length outside off, doesn't do very much off the pitch, but Rohit looks to steer it into the third man region with an open face, and the ball zips past his edge
full, straightening a touch along an off-stump line, defends watchfully, careful not to look too leg-side and get squared up
length ball nipping in and keeping a touch low on off stump. Jams down hurriedly to block to midwicket

fullish on off stump, straightens again. Rohit's bat comes down at an angle as he looks to play it to mid-on, and the ball straightens to hit the outside edge and roll along the floor into the covers. Legcutter
fullish, close to off stump, blocked to short cover, and the crowd applauds Broad's maiden
pushed through outside off, Rahane drops to his knee and sweeps this with the intended break through backward square leg

there it is: seventh Test century for Rohit.. What an innings this has been, and he looks good for more. He raises his bat, soaks in the applause from the crowd and the dressing room. He reaches the milestone off only 130 balls on a day-one turner. Length ball on middle, Rohit goes low and sweeps it with control, placed fine of long leg. Quite fittingly, he gets to the landmark with a sweep. It has thrown the England spinners off their lines and lengths today
jabbed away to the right of the bowler
shorter and drifts away outside off, lashed to cover off the back foot
down the track and quietly played back towards the back
back of a length and outside off, solidly punches to short cover
full and heading towards the pads, picked off through the vacant spaces at midwicket
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, watchfully defended off the front foot
on a length and slanting in towards off, Rohit opens the bat-face and guides it towards point
Rohit opens the bat-face to another length delivery outside off, this time he picks the gap between gully and backward point
back of a length and outside off, nothing doing from Rohit
back of a length and drifts away outside off, nicely punched off the back foot to the left of mid-off
down the track and clipped to short midwicket
Rohit uses his feet again, drives to the right of short mid-on, where the fielder throws himself to his right, deflecting the ball towards short midwicket
fractionally short and spins in at off, Rohit camps back and punches to short mid-on
down the track and belted away between deep midwicket and wide long-on
Rohit allows the ball to spin in from outside off. Hangs back, opens the face and deftly glides it past the right of the slip fielder
very full and homing in at off, Rohit closes his bat-face and taps it to the right of silly mid-on. A silly mid-off is in place as well
Broad pulls his length back, back of a length on the stumps, forced off the back foot to midwicket
wide of the crease, full and largely holds its line outside off as opposed to coming in, tip and run into the covers
much fuller and slanting in at off, played back to the bowler
full on off, defended to short cover's left
seems like a cutter, which is quietly worked to the leg side by Rahane
dangled up on middle, Rohit uses his feet and blocks it resolutely
Rohit uses his feet once again, Leach drags his length back, hits the pad as the ball rolls to cover
wide of the crease, drifts, turns and bounces to zip past the outside edge

Rohit advances at Leach once again, the left-arm fingerspinner fires it quicker and gets it to slide in from that angle. Rohit brings his bat down at an angle and sends an inside edge towards fine leg, where Burns cleans up
shorter and just outside off, Rahane jumps back, gets on top of the bounce and cuts it with the spin to the left of backward point
shorter, quicker turn for Leach, Rahane goes back and punches strongly but straight to cover
tossed up on middle, chipped wide of short midwicket
beautiful dip into a good length, Rahane searches for a drive and seems to have inside-edged onto the pad
tossed up outside off and spins in, Rahane stretches out to smother the spin
looped up outside off, spins in, Rahane steps out, has a crack at it, dragging the ball in front of the onrushing mid-on fielder
Rahane is right back to this short ball which drifts away from his outside off. Crisply punched away to the left of short cover
tossed up liberally outside off, eased down to long-on
pushed through on the pads, clipped away through the gap at midwicket
full and drifts into middle and leg, Rahane nurdles it to square leg and scampers across to the other end
sliding in at off, Rohit opens the face and defends
wide of the crease, finishes on the pads, Rohit whips it with the wrists to the right of mid-on. Broad chases hard, slides, and hauls the ball in
floated up on middle, Rohit stretches out to defend
shorter and spins away outside off, Rohit now goes back and punches a single to deep cover
full-toss on middle, Rohit cracks it straight to short midwicket
flighted just a shade outside off, not much turn, played back to Moeen
Rohit shimmies out to dead-bat another offbreak on off stump
Moeen shifts his line wider of off, full, Rohit stretches out, gets his hands low and sweeps it with the turn to the left of long leg for four. Hit in the air but over short leg
quicker and outside off, worked to midwicket
whisked away to the right of long-on
short, flat, punched from an off-stump line to deep cover
shorter, quicker turn for Leach, Rahane forces it off the back foot but finds cover
on a length and drifts in from wide of the crease, safely negotiated off the back foot
tossed up and dips at off, forward and smothered
much fuller and outside off, Rahane stretches out to drive through the line to cover
on a length and around off, defended with soft hands to silly-point
full and straightens on middle, clipped to short midwicket
worked to short midwicket once again
springs off the surface. On a length and sliding across off, sharp extra bounce, messes with Rohit's cut as an edge flies to the right of Stokes
down the track and jabbed back to the bowler
full and pushed across off, Rohit bends forward to dead-bat it away
down the track and whips this leg-stump delivery to deep midwicket
fullish and on off, defended off the front foot
dropped short and wide outside off, spins away, Rohit scythes it away behind point, and raises the century stand
full and dips into off stump, blocked off the front foot again
on a length and spins away outside off, guided to backward point
shorter and skids into off, Rohit jumps back and punches to mid-off
on a length, threatens to curve in but spins away outside off, Rohit swishes his bat out of the way and lets it go
on a good length and holds its line just a shade outside off, blocked back to Stone off the front foot
fuller and sliding in at off stump, Rahane presses forward and blocks it back once again
Rahane gets forward again, defending to cover this time
full and homes away outside off like a quick legcutter, Rahane feels for it and is beaten on the outside edge
pitched further up and angling in at off stump, pushed back to Stone off the front foot
shorter ad on a fourth-stump line, Rahane gets right behind the line in defence
looped up on off, Rohit defends off the front foot
shorter and slides in, Rohit blocks to the off side from the crease
worked off the pads to the right of short leg
looped up around off, hint of turn for Leach, prodded to the left of silly-point off an outside edge
more sharp turn and bounce, Rahane presses forward to defend, off the outside edge near the shoulder of the bat, but doesn't carry to Root at second slip
darted shorter and flatter, Rahane is right back to this length, punching a single through the covers
beats the edge with his first ball. Zippy away-seamer in the fifth-stump channel, on a length, and Rahane has a slightly loose poke at it
full, quite close to off stump, punched to mid-on
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and defends towards point
full, a bit of inward shape towards off stump. Good stride forward to cover the movement and block it back to the bowler

length ball, shifts his line a bit wider. Again a little bit of inward shape, towards the shiny side, and the ball hits the inside edge of the bat as Rahane presses forward to defend, bat and pad close together
full, swerving in just a touch towards off stump, clipped to midwicket
half-appeal from short leg, nothing from anyone else, as Rohit presses forward to defend one that dips and turns back sharply from just outside off. Only pad there
length ball outside off, good stride forward to block into the off side
another appeal as Rohit misses a sweep from outside off. Too much bounce on this occasion, over the top edge and smacks into his shoulder
down the track now, gets close to the pitch and punches it back to the bowler
goes back to one spinning in towards off stump, defends to short leg

big appeal for lbw as Rohit misses another sweep. Nitin Menon shakes his head, and England choose not to review. Good ball from Moeen, slowed it down and beat the batsman with lack of pace. Impact was just outside off, though
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and defends towards point

sharp bouncer, skiddy bounce towards Rahane's front shoulder, cramping him for room on the hook. Only manages to glove it, and it loops towards the leg gully region, but there's no one there to catch it
back of a length, quite a lot of width, and Rohit stands tall to free his arms and punch through point
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length, fairly close to off stump, punched into the covers
length ball, angling into off stump, from wide of the crease, stays back and blocks it back to the bowler
looks to step out, doesn't quite reach the pitch of this one spinning in towards off stump, punches to short extra-cover
lovely. Skitters out of his crease to the flighted ball outside off, and gets right up to the pitch of it this time. Driven sweetly between mid-off and extra-cover
flighted, pitched up closer to off stump, gets forward to whip to midwicket
steps out again and Moeen bowls it slower and gets it to drop a little shorter than Rahane wants, outside off. Stretches out and blocks with bat and pad close together
and there's the shorter ball that Rahane was pressuring him into bowling. Skips right back, makes a bit of room, and stabs it with precision through the point region
tossed up slow outside off, stretches out and smothers it nicely
shortish, angling into the hip, tucked away to long leg. 145.1kph
shortish, a bit of extra bounce as it nips in towards off and middle. Takes his bottom hand away to jab it down into the leg side
nice stride forward to a fullish inswinger outside off, defends to cover point
short, sits up at waist height just outside off, and Rahane finds the gap to the right of deep square leg with a short-arm pull. Just tapped the ball on its head on top of its bounce

there's that reverse inswing again, and he manages to beat Rahane's defence and hit his pad, but he's taken a big stride forward and made sure the impact is outside off. Ah, and a thick inside edge too
and again. This time there's no inside edge and the appeal is louder, but again Rahane's stride has got him outside the line of off stump. England think of reviewing and decide against it
full-toss on off stump, punched down the ground to long-on
tossed up slow, wider outside off, good stride forward to block into the covers

ooh, Rahane plays slightly in front of his body there. Loop and dip outside off, and he was looking to flick, and he plays a touch early and the ball hangs briefly in the air before dropping short of short midwicket
fuller outside off, jabbed back towards the bowler
sharp turn and bounce, and Rahane, looking to make room to cut, is beaten on the top edge by a distance. Superb take from a jumping Foakes behind the wicket. That was leaping almost vertically at him
and there's the fifty, superb innings from Rahane. Skips out nimbly to the flighted ball outside off and clips it down to long-on
length ball outside off, a bit of shape in again. Presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
fuller, wider, left alone. This one didn't swing back. Maybe he changed the direction of the shine?
fullish, closer to off stump, good stride forward to defend into the off side
length ball, wider line than the previous one, left alone
shortish, a bit of width, chopped down to point. He made sure he rolled his wrists over to keep it down
full, closer to off stump, good stride forward to drive towards mid-off
tossed up wide of off, swept to the fielder at deep midwicket, who's stationed quite square
once again that line wide of off, quite full, and Rahane looks to drive against the turn. Possibly gets too close to the pitch of it, and gets a thick edge that runs away wide of slip
now Rahane employs the sweep from that wide line outside off, out to that man at deep midwicket
tossed up on off stump. Wants to whip this to long-on, ends up meeting it on the full with the outside half of his bat and hitting it to mid-off instead
looks for that sweep again, from wide of off. Thick inside edge into his boot
tossed up slower this time, and Rahane stretches out to block into the covers
fullish, angling into middle and leg, clipped quietly through backward square leg
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
fuller, quite close to off stump, defended into the covers
fullish, fourth-stump line, moves easily forward and into line to defend towards mid-off
fullish on off stump, no real movement, defended back to the bowler
full, a tiny hint of shape in towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up fairly wide of off, presses forward to defend with soft hands into the off side

looped up on that wide line, and Rohit sweeps again, this time to the left of deep midwicket. Bess, who's on as a substitute there, sprints then gets his knee stuck in the turf as he slides into position, and misfields into the boundary. That soft outfield could be very dangerous
back of a length outside off, leans back and plays the late dab wide of slip

goes for that sweep again, from that wide line. More topspin on this occasion, and it's bowled slower too, so he top-edges it to the left of the keeper. Didn't get down into a stable position, and nearly lost his footing as he swivelled through his shot
flatter, skips back and makes room to punch through cover point
quicker, closer to off stump, goes back and defends right by his feet

ooh, good ball from Broad, a bit of inward movement from just outside off. Shortish stride forward from Rohit, and he plays slightly away from his body in defence. Thick inside edge rolls away through backward square leg
back of a length, this one goes away in the corridor, like a legcutter, and he reads it well and defends into the gully region
full outside off, driven to the left of mid-off
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and works it into the square leg region
fullish, angling into off stump, defended back to the bowler
on the fuller side of a good length, just outside off, presses forward to block into the covers
ooh, slides one across the batsman, no turn, and Rohit, shuffling across to defend, is beaten on the outsid edge
tossed up on middle and leg, blocked back to the bowler
shuffles out to this flighted ball outside leg, clips to midwicket
quick one on the pads, clipped to short leg
nicely bowled, quite full on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
nice length, straightening towards leg stump, presses forward and blocks to midwicket
fullish, a bit of shape in towards off stump. Presses forward to defend, and the ball rolls towards short midwicket off the inside edge
length ball close to off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
short, gets up to above head height over off stump, pulled round to long leg, meeting it with the bat pointing up and doing well to keep it down
back of a length, angling into leg stump, tucked away through square leg
length ball on leg stump, clipped quietly to the right of square leg
looks to step out and can't quite get to the pitch of this flighted ball floated across him. Closes his bat face early and the leading edge rolls into the covers
a touch short on the pads, goes right back to work it to deep square leg
steps out to the flighted ball just outside leg, stretches out to block it back to the bowler
flat, on the pads, nurdled away through backward square leg to bring up 150. Yet again, he's got to a hundred and carried on and on
flat and quite full on leg stump, gets forward and defends solidly
steps out, meets this one on the full just outside leg and clips to midwicket
fired into the pads, clipped to the right of short leg, who makes a diving stop

quicker length ball, gets forward to defend and the ball strikes pad before bat. Was angling in and pitching on middle and leg, not sure it straightened enough to hit the stumps. Only a half-hearted appeal
quickish on off stump, goes back to dab gently into the point region
quickish and fairly full on middle and leg, defended into the on side
tossed up full on off stump, presses forward and dabs with soft hands into the point region
flat, not quite short enough to cut, and it slides on towards off stump. Makes room and hurriedly chops towards backward point
round-arm, quite flat on middle and leg, goes back to clip to midwicket
down the track, and Root slants it away from off stump. Stretches out to jab it into the backward point region
quite a way down the leg side, and Rohit misses the sweep. Foakes stretches his left hand out, and grabs on despite being unsighted
quickish on the pads, clipped to short leg
flat one fired across the stumps, skips out and blocks it back
down the track and he fires it at Rohit's feet. Flicks hurriedly and in the air, but Pope can't grab onto it at short leg. Went very quickly to him, so you can't really call it a chance
short, quick, sliding into the hips. Rahane camps back and whips it in the air but away from the reach of both short leg and short midwicket
another ball that slides in, full, and strikes the pad, but not threatening the stumps
mid-on is in the circle and Rohit goes over the top. Pushed through on middle and leg, down the track and clouted over that fielder for four
fired into middle stump, Rohit stretches out to block it back to Leach
darted on off or just a shade outside off, Rohit goes low and elects to sweep it away fine to the left of Foakes

top ball from Leach. Goes past Rohit's outside edge and Foakes whips the bails off. Fullish, drifting in, then gripping and turning away in the channel. Leach drags Rohit forward and beats his outside edge. The keeper gathers the ball and breaks the bails. Is Rohit's back foot on the line? Looks tight, but the TV umpire Chaudhary reckons Rohit may have got some part of his back foot behind the line. Rohit survives in the end
down the track and clipped away to deep midwicket
straightens a touch from around the wicket, Rohit keeps it out
shorter on middle, jabbed on the bounce to short leg
shorter and sliding across off, Rohit gets on top of the bounce and firmly punches through the point region
darted down the leg side, no shot
Pope flings to his right from short leg to intercept this defensive push from Rohit
short, flat, Rahane picks the length early once again, dropping back to crack it away through point
fired on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
flighted on off, hint of turn, Rahane runs it away past the right of slip with soft hands. Another puff of dust from the surface
on a length and outside off, Rahane hauls a sweep to deep midwicket
floated up outside off, turn and bounce, left alone

After having survived a stumping in the previous over off Leach, Rohit now holes out to deep square leg. Pushed through on middle, Rohit sweeps from the stumps, but does not get it off the middle. (Mis)hit him low on the bat and balloons into the hands of Moeen. England finally find a way past this pair after a wicketless afternoon session
darted on middle, stabbed away to the right of short midwicket
drifts in from around the wicket, then rips away past the outside edge
flatter and fuller on leg stump, pushed away to the left of Moeen
on a length and on off, defended back to the bowler
on a length, holds up in the pitch, grips and turns. Pant checks his drive and almost spoons a return catch
darted into the pads, Pant plays back and does not make contact with a flick
pushed through and dips at off and middle, Rahane defends gingerly and almost drags it back onto the stumps

Pope and England think they have Rahane. The ball loops to Pope at short leg. Not given caught by umpire Sharma. Speared fuller and flatter at leg stump, Rahane closes his bat-face, the ball seems to have looped off the pad to Pope and not off the bat. Umpire Sharma's on-field not-out call stays
jabbed to the right of the bowler
shorter and outside off, pushed to the covers
looped up on off, played back to the bowler
pushed through on off, Rahane deflects the sweep behind square on the leg side
big turn and bounce, Rahane is in a tangle, off the thigh pad and loops to short leg

After bowling Kohli earlier in the day, Moeen castles Rahane as well. Offbreak, dangled up invitingly, and dipping on Rahane's sweep. He is nowhere close to the pitch. The ball drops in front of him, defeats him, and rattles the stumps
floated up outside off, Ashwin ventures down the track and drives to mid-off
Ashwin gets forward and prods it to the left of short leg
down the track and bunted to mid-on hanging back
on a length and slides in at the top of off, played back to Moeen off the back foot
on a length and outside off, down the track, Ashwin doesn't get close enough to the pitch either and drags it away just wide of mid-on
fuller and drifting in to hit the inside edge and roll away to the leg side
slightly short and outside off, Pant rocks back and scythes it away through the cover-point region
turn and bounce from the rough patch outside off, Pant plays back and fends it down
too full for the sweep, Pant jumps across and hauls it away in the direction of long leg
quickish slider outside off, left alone in the channel
darted outside leg, Pant is happy to kick it away
slides in, no turn, Pant blocks off the back foot
looped up nicely, Pant quietly kocks it towards point
prodded in the air off an inside edge but to the right of short leg
whipped off the back foot to square leg
dangled up on middle, defended back to the bowler
tossed outside off, down the track and struck firmly to mid-off
welcome back to the IPL, Jack! Tossed up on the rough outside off, Pant skips down the track and mows it over midwicket for six
Leach pulls his length back outside off, Pant aims a slog-sweep, miscues it to midwicket
flighted and outside off, Pant stretches out to smother it
flat and outside off, whipped firmly off the back foot through midwicket
looped up on middle, dead-batted away by Ashwin
full on middle, pushed back
drifts in from wide of the crease, spins away to take the outside edge and roll away past slip
sweet as. Flighted and a bit too full outside off, full-toss in fact, Ashwin uses his reach to good effect and laces a cover-drive
tossed outside off, driven with an open face straight to short cover
Moeen finds turn and dip to mess with Ashwin's drive, off the inner half but wide of Pope at short leg
length-ball offbreak, Ashwin safely negotiates it
...and spins one past the outside edge. Angling into the rough, skips away past the edge
Pant gets forward, opens the bat-face, and picks up a single square through the off side
pushed through on leg stump, from around the wicket, Ashwin has a jab at it, pops into the pitch
tossed outside leg and explodes from the surface, Ashwin dares to sweep and seems to have gloved it away over the keeper
full and pushed across off, Ashwin uses his feet and squirts it away behind square on the off side
full and sliding across off, down the track and stroked back to Root
dangled up on leg stump, blocked back
pushed through on middle, Pant stretches out to defend it to cover
much fuller on off, Pant replies with another front-foot defence
Mooen tosses it up on the stumps, Pant dares to reverse-sweep from there. He gets it over backward point and finds the fence
clobbered over mid-off. Floated up just a shade outside off, Pant dashes down the track and hits it over the top

four, four, and out? Pant calls for a review. On a length, angling in towards off, making Pant play. It grips and turns, did that take the outside edge on the way to Foakes who rides the bounce and collects the ball? No bat involved, the review saves Pant
pushed through on leg stump, explodes from the deck, Ashwin jabs to where silly-point may have been
darted on leg stump, defended
pushed through from around the wicket, straightens as Ashwin uses his feet and jabs it to Pope at short leg. Extra bounce for Root this time
full, Root drags Axar forward into a defence and then gets it to spin past the outside edge
Axar gets forward to defend this full offbreak on off
sliding into the pads defended to the leg side
full, grips, and spins away outside off, Pant plays back and pushes the ball to the covers
fired into the leg stump, Pant blocks it to the left of the bowler
floated up on off, Pant deploys a big stride and defensively guides the ball to point. Foakes runs around, slides, and his pad-buckle seems to have snapped. Foakes waits for a new right pad
dragged down outside off, fast and short, Pant lines it up and pulls it powerfully over a ducking Pope at short leg. Bam
tossed up on off stump, Pant stretches forward to smother this
speared into middle and leg, Pant plays back and blocks it back to Moeen
flighted on the pads, knocked away to the left of short midwicket as Axar gets off the mark

Did this straighten enough from around the wicket? On a length and slides in with the arm, Pant camps back and is struck on the front pad on the knee-roll. Not given lbw, and England decide against a review
turn and bounce outside off, left alone
more turn and bounce outside off, no shot once again
fired on middle and leg, dinked into the midwicket region
on the pads, Pant clips it to long leg
on a length and nibbles away outside off, Pant tucks his bat inside the line and lets it go
fuller and holds its line outside off, Pant shoulders arms
back of a length and outside off, tapped to point off the back foot
full and angling in from around the wicket, Axar leans across and stylishly flicks it through square leg. A touch too straight from Stone
on a length and straightens to beat Axar's defensive push and zip past the outside edge
back of a length on off, blocked
tossed up outside off, from around the wicket, drills it to cover
leans forward, but doesn't quite get to the pitch of the ball, so he has to reach out away from his body to defend
quicker delivery into the pads, defends into the leg side
quicker and flatter outside off, he doesn't play
drives through the covers for a single.
lets go a good length ball outside off from around the wicket
no shot to a good length ball outside off
absolutely nails the pull as Stone goes short. That's 300 up for India. Keeps it along the ground even with the ball above chest-height. Superb control.
strikes him on the left bicep as a back of a length ball straightens on Pant.
blocks out a short ball at 143 kph, pulling the bottom hand off the bat, the hand that was hit in the last ball
full toss almost lobbed to midwicket. But it bounces first and that is the end of the day's play.
flat, quick, on leg stump, tickled around to short fine leg
flat one slanted across to off stump, stays in the crease and blocks with soft hands

beaten. Quick length ball fired across the stumps, and Axar defends from the crease, playing for the turn, and it goes on straight and past his outside edge. Foakes fails to gather cleanly, shockingly
fuller, on middle and off, defended into the off side
a touch shorter on leg stump, goes back and defends to short leg
length ball wide of off stump, padded away and there isn't too much of an enthusiastic lbw appeal, because it wasn't spinning back enough to hit the stumps
back of a length close to off stump, punched down to long-off

got him, superb work from Foakes, and a lovely delivery too. They go upstairs, but I think Axar knows he's a goner. Dangled up loopily outside off, and it dips to make Axar reach out to drive. That causes him to lift his back leg, and the ball turns past his groping bat and into Foakes' gloves, and the bails go off before anyone can catch their breath. Superb
flighted ball fairly wide of off, big stride forward to defend

got him, Moeen has struck with a full-toss. Tossed up, angling into the stumps, and Ishant fails to read the length and is also a little late getting forward for the attempted sweep. Ends up top-edging it, and short midwicket runs a couple of steps to his right to take a simple catch
full, angling into off stump, gets forward to smother it
turn from a full length outside off. Kuldeep is forward to defend, and the edge streaks past the gully fielder diving to his left
looks to step out and Root bowls it quick, close to off stump, stretches out and blocks into the on side of the pitch
quickish length ball fairly wide of off. Reaches out to sweep, and inside-edges into his back leg

down the track now to the flighted ball on off stump, and he gets close enough to the pitch to hit against the turn and clear the wide long-on boundary comfortably. Difficult shot to play on a turning pitch
flat length ball skidding on towards off stump, goes deep in his crease and makes room to stab it out to third man. He runs the first one hard, but there's no second run on offer
full, wide of off stump, gets his head over the ball and pushes to point with an open face

flat length ball on off stump, no turn, stretches out to defend and the inside edge rolls to the left of backward square leg. A single was available but they decline it to bring Pant on strike for the next over

hit hard, and it's past the bowler before he can react. May have grazed his fingers at just around shoulder height. Steps out, meets this quick one on the full, and drives it back incredibly hard. A half-chance, you might say. No way long-off was cutting it off to his left

down the track again, converts another ball to a full-toss. This one's just around thigh high outside off, and he steps away from the line to make a bit more hitting room and wallop it straight of long-on
flat length ball on off stump, lets it come and looks for the quick single to the left of slip, but he's wisely sent back. The nervous 49s

down the track to the flighted ball around off stump, steps across to be able to nurdle it into the short midwicket region and hurry across to bring up another splendid half-century. What a cricketer he is
tossed up outside off, stretches out nicely and defends to silly point

soft hands, and the edge doesn't carry to first slip. Gets on the front foot again, but this one lands on a slightly shorter length and turns away. You'll have to say he played that well, didn't let his bat go too far from his body in defence
quick length ball wide of off stump, left alone. Too wide to play at it, really
and again, very wide of off stump and Pant isn't drawn into a shot
fired in quick, wide outside off, and again Pant leaves it alone
four leaves in a row. Again that extremely wide line outside off
steps out and across to the off side to get close to this ball, meet it on the full, and open his face to steer to deep point
tossed up full outside off, left alone
down the track to the flighted ball outside off, driven firmly to long-off. Refuses the single
flat, shortish, wide of off, left alone
short outside off, slapped to deep point. No single again
sees some flight just outside off, and he steps out, skips slightly inside the line, and frees his arms to loft it straight of long-off and clear the boundary with ease
sharp turn and bounce outside off, beats the edge as Pant attempts to cut
flat, quick offbreak outside off, and Pant doesn't have any time to move his feet there. Looks to jab it square on the off side for a single, and it zips past his outside edge. Well bowled
quick offbreak outside off, left alone
tossed up fuller and closer to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
flat one on leg stump, quite full, defended into the on side
quick slider angling in towards off stump, nice stride forward to block into the covers
yorker close to off stump, jams his bat down and keeps it out comfortably
nicely played. Flat one straightening towards off stump, and he gets a good stride forward to defend into the covers
steps out to the length ball outside off, dabs gently into the cover point region and sprints across. He wanted two, but the keeper ran quickly to catch up with the ball and keep him down to one
bouncer, doesn't get up as high as Kuldeep expects, and hits him on the front shoulder as he ducks to try and evade it

got him, excellent follow-up delivery. Back of a length close to off stump, straightens just a touch, and you can see Kuldeep was expecting the bouncer there. His feet go nowhere, and he gets squared up as he has a nibble at it, looking to run it down towards third man probably. Thin edge through to Foakes
short outside off, and Siraj makes a bit of extra room and uppercuts it crisply over the backward point region
tries the same shot, but this time he fails to make the contact he wants. Short again, outside off, and the attempted uppercut ends up as a bottom-edge through to the keeper
length ball, straightens in the fifth-stump corridor, left alone
fuller, again some movement away from the left-hander, but it starts quite wide and he can leave comfortably

big appeal for lbw, and Virender Sharma thinks long and hard and finally raises his finger! Burns has reviewed, again after a lengthy consultation. He was caught on the crease there. Length ball, nipping back in past the inside edge of his defensive push. The ball strikes him in line with middle and leg, fairly deep in his crease, and ball-tracking returns an umpire's call verdict on where it's projected to strike leg stump. Superb bowling from Ishant, he's given India the early breakthrough. The lack of footwork from Burns got him in trouble there, but that was brought about by the length Ishant hit
length ball angling into middle stump, defended to mid-off
length ball, again he's targeting the stumps, and Lawrence blocks it back to the bowler without getting too much of a stride in

what an over, what a ball to end it. Ishant ends up falling over in his follow-through, but only after he's produced a peach. Perfect length again, in the corridor, brings Lawrence half-forward to defend, and it straightens past his outside edge
length ball spinning in towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler from the crease
quickish length ball on middle and off, defended into the on side
tossed up fuller and wider, big stretch out to smother the spin
ooh, that nearly carries to leg gully! Turn and bounce from a good length just outside off as Sibley defends a fair way in front of his body, and the edge drops short of Kohli at leg gully
fuller now, clipped watchfully to short midwicket
tossed up full outside off, clipped towards Kuldeep, who's at a deepish, square midwicket. Had to cover a bit of ground away from his natural side, so they take a quick single
fullish on middle and off, defended back to the bowler from the crease. Kept slightly low, possibly
length ball, drifts onto the pads, clipped away and finds the gap to the left of long leg. That sort of error in line is understandable when the bowler is looking to bowl a straighter line
fullish outside off, left alone

ooh, jags in with extra bounce from a  good length. Ishant is really testing the batsmen here. Looks to defend, and the ball passes the inside edge, hits the unprotected right elbow - a glancing blow - and ricochets down onto the back leg
full, angling into off and middle, steps across to clip to the left of long leg
fullish on middle and off, defended towards mid-on
length-ball offbreak from Ashwin, defended back to him
Lawrence stretches out and pushes this with the spin towards mid-on
was that a carrom ball? Not quite sure, it disturbs the surface as well. Blocked off the front foot
this largely slides on with the arm outside off, Lawrence searches for turn and is emphatically beaten on the outside edge
tossed-up liberally and dips sharply on Lawrence as he shuffles across off stump and does not make contact with a sweep. The lbw appeal is quickly shot down
another lovely little offbreak from Ashwin, dips and turns in, Lawrence aims for the sweep again, ends up edging it to leg-slip
nice and full as Ishant explores the channel outside off. Sibley isn't tempted (yet)
fullish and on a fourth-stump line, quietly blocked back to the bowler

Ishant snags the outside edge, but it streaks away past the cordon. Ishant keeps it full, angling in, and straightening a wee bit to kiss the outside edge and roll away past the right of Rahane at gully
very full and homing in at off stump, blocked towards midwicket
a touch too full, Ishant brings this ball back in as well, Sibley deploys a solid stride and drives it to the left of diving short midwicket and right of mid-on for a charming boundary

Ishant adjusts his length. He drags it back and gets it to hold its line in the channel. Sibley fiddles with it as the ball passes the outside edge. The opening batsman did well not to stab at it, though
full and skidding in on middle, as Ashwin hurries Lawrence into a defence
Lawrence steps out and drives a length ball only as far as short midwicket
on a length and breaks in, quicker, disturbs the surface, played back to Ashwin
Ashwin slows this up, holds this one back, dips into off stump, forward and smothered
prodded in the air but doesn't carry to short leg or short midwicket
fractionally short and spins in at the top of off. Lawrence is right back to close out a maiden
Ishant hits the full length again, swerves back in and stays low. Sibley stoops low to jam it out
full and slanting in, this doesn't keep as low, so easily negotiated by Sibley
back of a length and outside off, not close enough to off to make Sibley
good length and nipping in towards middle, forward and bunted to short midwicket
Sibley presses forward to this length ball slanting in at off and drops a single to cover
Lawrence now presses forward to block out this length ball on off
has it straightened enough to threaten the stumps. Not given out lbw, India don't review either. Pitches in line, has Sibley toppling over

another appeal by India, this one's for the catch. Not given once again. But India choose to review this. Did this brush the glove on the way up? Pushed through on middle, Sibley goes for the sweep, but Ashwin finds extra bounce. Sibley thinks he's gone and walks off. Ultra Edge confirms that it kissed the back of the bat on the way to Kohli at leg-slip
shortish and outside off, punched to point
full on off stump, drops to one knee and sweeps to deep square leg
on a length and sliding across off, run away to point with soft hands
back of a length and quicker on off, Lawrence diffuses it
turn and bounce right away! On a length, spins away outside off, Root plays back and edges it with soft hands wide of silly-point. Axar raises a puff of dust first ball in Test cricket
tosses it up, drifts towards off and turns past the outside edge. Another top ball from Axar. So very difficult to handle quick turn on this pitch
sliding in at off, defended
on a length and outside off, Root gets forward and pats it to point
full and holds its line outside off, pushed into the covers
Axar drags his length back, getting it to slide in at top of off. Root skips back and blocks it resolutely
non-turner, on a length on middle, pushed to mid-on. Lawrence gets off the mark after 19 balls
tossed around off, more explosion from the surface, swept away behind square
down the track and blocked to short leg
skidding on and staying low outside off. The batsman stoops low, but still can't touch it
on a length and turns in, defended back off the back foot
88ks from Ashwin, full and attacking off, defended
pushed through on off or just a shade outside off, hauled away through midwicket with a firm sweep
back of a length and slides in at off, negotiated off the back foot

top-edged into the lap of Ashwin at short fine leg. Axar roars and celebrates his maiden Test wicket. Axar loops it up just a shade outside off, disturbs the surface, Root dares to sweep against the spin with short fine in place. The ball bounces, hits the top edge, and that's a dolly for Ashwin. Rohit felt that the sweep wasn't quite a risky option for him because England hadn't posted a short fine leg for him. But here there's a fielder to gobble it up. Massive wicket for India
slides on outside off, Stokes plays for turn and is beaten on the outside edge
fuller on the stumps, pushed down the ground

wide of the crease, arm ball, fizzes off the pitch to beat the inside edge and hit the front pad above the knee-roll. Probably, this delivery was doing too much. Ball-tracking suggests umpire's call on leg stump. No inside edge
squirted away past silly-point
turn for Ashwin, of the slower variety, full, played back to him
Lawrence stretches out and clips it with the spin to short midwicket
tossed-up offbreak, dips sharply, Lawrence is forward, but isn't close to the pitch. Jabbed into the covers
darted into the pads from around the wicket, flicked to midwicket
Lawrence is tired of blocking. He steps out, but is beaten in flight. He ends up dragging the ball in the air to the right of mid-on. Ashwin won't mind this at all
pushed through outside off, Stokes rolls out a sweep and places it fine of long leg
darted into off, some spin for Axar, Stokes has a short stride and defends to the off side
shorter and drifts away outside off, allowing Stokes to go back and jab it to point
on a length and outside off, 92ks, tip and run to cover-point
speared into middle from wide of the crease, Lawrence whisks it away to the right of square leg
on a length on off, dead-batted away by Lawrence
dangled up outside off, Stokes stretches out and drives it crisply through the line to the off-side sweeper
flighted outside off and spins into finish at off, played back off the front foot
Ashwin pulls his length back and gets it to bounce sharply, opens the face and glides to point
slider from Ashwin, 91ks, loops off the thigh pad to short leg
starts outside off, spins and bounces. Lawrence gets back and keeps it out
down the track and pushed to the right of Ashwin as mid-on mops it up
tossed up on off stump, Lawrence moves forward and blocks it back to Axar
slower and outside off, pushed back off the front foot again
wide of the crease, drifting into the pads, deflected away towards square leg
quick, round-arm dart from Axar, hits the pad, but this is surely heading down leg with that sharp angle
on a length on middle, Lawrence closes the bat-face and blocks to the leg side
Lawrence uses his feet, Axar drags his length back and pushes it on middle, clipped away to the right of mid-on
tossed-up offbreak outside off, Lawrence advances down the pitch, closes the bat-face, Ashwin draws a leading-edge to the covers. No silly-point in for Ashwin
down the track and whisked away to the left of short midwicket and right of mid-on for a single
tossed on off stump, Stokes presses forward to smother it

another top ball from Ashwin! He thinks he has Stokes lbw and coaxes Kohli into a review. Fuller than a good length, drifts in from around the wicket, beats the edge as Stokes has a defensive push at it, breaks away to hit the flap of the back pad. Stokes it squared up and can't touch it. The tracker suggests that it would have bounced over off stump. Kohli isn't too pleased
fired on off, stabbed to the covers
full and dips in at off stump, Stokes can't connect with a sweep
on a length, drifts from outside off and spins away past the uncertain prod of Lawrence
on a length on off, 97ks, defended to the leg side
another round-arm dart on the stumps, blocked to the leg side
fired flat and full on off, played back to the bowler
on a length on off, defended back to him again
jabbed away to the leg side off an inside edge
on a length and slides in at off, defended back to the bowler
on a length again, drifts in from around the wicket and rips away past the outside edge
squirted through the cover-point region
darted on middle from round the wicket, pushed to mid-on
full and pushed through on off, blocked

Lawrence has been put out of his misery - out off the last ball before lunch. He slumps to his knees. Ashwin pushes it through, attacking the stumps from around the wicket. He finds turn and bounce, another ball that disturbs the surface. Lawrence jabs in front of his body and pops a catch to Gill at short leg
back of a length, spinning into the stumps, goes back and defends down the pitch
back of a length again, starts a bit wider outside off without too much turn back in, goes back and punches through cover point
again he lets him stay on the back foot with a marginally short length outside off, stabbed to the left of backward point
goes back to one that doesn't turn, looks to cut, and nearly inside-edges back onto his off stump
now there's flight and turn from a line just outside off. Sharp, sharp turn to beat the front-foot defensive
wow. Straighter one, then one that rips away, then the one that goes with the arm again. Goes back to make room and punch, and he's lucky to inside-edge onto his back leg
tossed up full on off stump, driven to mid-off
flat one slides on towards the pads, clipped wide of mid-on. No one at midwicket

he's living dangerously here. Ashwin has a man out at deep forward square leg for just this shot, the top-edged sweep from outside off. Agarwal runs in towards his right, but the ball falls short of him
back around the wicket to Stokes, quick length ball outside off, left alone
tossed up slower and straighter, on off stump, gets a good stride forward to block it back to the bowler
looks to flatten his trajectory and ends up bowling a long-hop on off stump, pulled away to the left of deep square leg
back of a length outside off, steep bounce and turn after Pope leaves it
tossed up on leg stump, swept along the ground to short fine leg
tossed up on off stump, gets forward to block into the on side
flat one sliding on towards middle stump, defends into the on side with bat having to come around his front pad
another slider, onto off stump, goes back and defends to short extra-cover
tossed up wider outside off, stretches out and pushes into the cover point region
floated up on mddle stump, a hint of drift away before it turns back in. Presses forward to defend, and it runs away through backward square leg off the insde edge. Played with soft hands, though
turn and bounce outside off, left alone
tossed up slower on off stump, good stride forward to defend, off the inner half of the bat into the on side
again he plays for more turn than there is. Comes forward to defend one pitching on off stump, hits the inside edge and then his front pad
tossed up slower, just outside off, swept along the ground to the left of deep square leg
steps out now and he can't get to the pitch of this flighted ball outside off. Blocked back towards the bowler
flat, angled across the left-hander, defended off the back foot into the off side

ooh, finds the edge with one that keeps going with the angle. This is so difficult to negotiate on a turning pitch. Comes forward to defend with an open face, and the edge doesn't carry to Rahane at slip
now this one straightens with a lot of extra bounce, on a leg-stump line, manages to keep it down to the left of leg gully

turn and bounce again on that leg-stump line, this time he rings Stokes forward to defend, and it brushes the inside edge, then pops up off pad to the right of Kohli at leg gully. He can't get to it with the dive
flat length ball close to off stump, presses forward to defend with the turn
fuller outside off, gets forward for the defensive push into the covers
flat length ball on middle and off, goes back and defends into the on side

bowled him, Stokes has missed a half-volley. It can happen when the bowler gets the kind of drift Ashwin does, but Stokes might still be disappointed with himself. Drifted in, and he looked to clip that towards midwicket, and that's a dangerous thing to do from a stump-to-stump line. Turns past his bat, and hits off stump
greets him with a flighted carrom ball on off stump, defended into the off side. The no-ball klaxon sounds for the first time in this Test match
tossed up outside off, clipped to midwicket
turn from a full length on off stump, clipped watchfully to short leg
flatter and quicker on off stump, good stride forward to block it back to the bowler
dips onto a good length outside off and turns back in, keeps his pad out of the way and defends with the full face
goes back to a slider on off stump, punches to short extra-cover
nice length on middle and off, gets a good stride forward to block it
shortish, a bit of width, and Pope steps right back to cut it to the left of the diving backward point fielder
better length, going with the angle towards off stump, good stride forward to block it back to the bowler
goes with the arm again, towards middle and leg, goes right back to work it through square leg
quickish, angling into the stumps, goes back and works it through square leg
ooh, beautiful. Drifts away from off stump and drops on the batsman a little. Comes forward to defend, and it turns just enough to take the outside edge, but again it falls short of Rahane at slip
quicker, close to off stump, goes back and blocks it back down the pitch
slow flight outside off, and Foakes' front foot makes a double movement to cover the line of the ball, before he defends into the on side. Clear sign of the ball doing things in the air.
again that double front-foot movement, to defend this one into the off side. The line was wider on this occasion

nicely bowled again. Drifts this across Foakes as he looks to step out, and he has to stretch out to cover the length. Doesn't turn as much as he expects, and it rolls to the left of backward point off the outside edge
length ball on off stump, stays around the wicket to Pope, and he goes back to tap it into the point region
tossed up close to off stump, good stride forward to block to silly point
steps out now and can't reach the pitch of this. Looks to work it across the line, he's hit on the pad, but outside the line
nice length close to off stump, quicker than the previous two balls, defended into the covers
a bit of bounce, but not so much turn, as he comes forward to defend this one pitching just outside off. Hits the inside half of the bat and rolls into the midwicket region
fuller, on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
slider, keeps going with the angle, with the round-arm release helping it along. Goes back and defends, and it hits the inside edge and then his back pad
goes back to a length ball on off stump, blocks it back to Ashwin
leg-stumpish line, gets forward to defend, and the ball bounces a touch and hits the high part of the bat but falls short of short leg
gets forward to defend another leg-stump ball, this time towards leg gully
a touch shorter, goes right back to work it through square leg
floated up full on off stump, clipped to short midwicket
flatter, goes with the angle from leg to middle, goes back and defends into the on side
probing off-stump line, brings Pope forward to defend. Off the outer half of the bat towards gully
quicker, gets a half-stride forward to block to silly point
he's been looking for the marginally short ball, and again he rocks right back to cut this, from an off-stump line, towards backward point

huge appeal from Axar as this one goes with the angle and hits the pad as Foakes plays slightly across the line in defence. Not given, and Kohli has a think before deciding to review... The front pad went across and came in the way of his bat swing there. No bat. Kept going with the angle, struck him in line with middle stump, but it's carrying on past leg stump and bouncing over according to ball-tracking. Kohli was indicating when discussions were on that the ball would bounce over.
fuller now, on middle and leg, clipped into the on side

straightens along an off-stump line with a bit of extra bounce. Slightly leg-side of the ball while defending this off the front foot, manages to squeeze it into the point region off the outside half of the bat

nice length, spins back from fairly wide of off. Presses forward, waits, and defends with soft hands, and the ball rolls backwards, not too close to the stumps  but producing some excitement from the close catchers
goes back now, to tap this one into the point region
slower, stretches out to sweep but can't get to it, hits his arm after beating his bat
steps out, can't reach the pitch, stabs it back to the bowler
quicker now, on off stump, goes right back to hurriedly defend towards short leg
flights this full, inviting the cover drive, does well to roll his wrists over and drive it straighter, to mid-off
length ball sliding on towards off stump. Half-forward to defend, rolls off the inside edge into the square leg region
beauty. Sharp turn from a middle-and-off line as Pope comes forward to defend, rips away, beats his edge, and bounces over off stump. Pant can't collect cleanly either
a touch short on off stump, and he's immediately right back to cut it to the left of backward point. Agarwal chases back and pulls it back with a sliding stop
round-arm, a touch short outside off, no turn, goes back to chop to backward point
slower outside off, a bit of turn and a lot of bounce, left alone
