huge appeal for lbw, two appeals, and Virender Sharma says not out. This one looked closer than the previous one to me. Impact may have been the issue. Came forward to defend, and the ball slid on with the angle, and ah, there's an inside edge into front pad. Great decision. Struck him just in line with off stump, I think
quicker one, goes on straight towards off stump, goes back and defends it back down the pitch
much slower, and Pope thinks of coming forward then goes back to defend it, close to off stump
down the track now as Ashwin gives this one air as well, clipped to mid-on
extra bounce now, pitching just outside leg and not really turning. Presses forward and just lets it hit the flap of his pad
steps out, and he's right to the pitch of this leg-stump ball to clip it neatly to the left of the diving mid-on fielder
tossed up slow on middle and leg, clipped to long-on
round-arm, angling into middle and off, gets forward to block towards midwicket
sharp turn outside off, and Foakes plays forward in defence, plays for the angle, and gets beaten by a wide margin
quiick and full on middle and leg, defended down the pitch off the front foot
fullish, angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
now he's in two minds whether to play or leave this outsde off. Hits his inside edge as he withdraws his bat and rolls towards gully
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up on leg stump, clipped to short leg

goes on the back foot to try and flick one that turns sharply from middle and leg. Misses, and Pant appeals extremely loudly and repeatedly, but it isn't given. Maybe a bit of back pad on that one. Yup, past the bat and off the thigh pad
down the track to this one tossed up on off stump, gets close to the pitch and works it with the turn into the square leg region
tossed up outside off, spinning back in, good stride forward to defend towards extra-cover
oooh, he's beaten by one that's full enough to be a half-volley. Floated across the right-hander, wide of off, inviting the cover drive. Goes with trhe angle and beats his outside edge
flatter, spinning into the stumps, goes back and clips it down towards leg gully
full on middle and leg, good stride forward to defend inside-out to short extra-cover
tossed up slower outside off, good stride forward to drive into the covers
full again, just outside off, defended to cover point
flat one zips through with the angle, beats the back-foot flick to hit back pad, but it's clearly missing leg stump
ooh, beauty. Tossed up slow, just outside off, makes him reach in front of his body to defend, and spins it past his edge
quicker on off stump, defended off the front foot into the covers
goes back to a quickish length ball spinning in from outside off, blocks into the covers
a touch short, straightening towards off stump, cramps him a little on the pull, out to square midwicket
tossed up nicely on off stump, defended off the front foot to short midwicket
flighted ball just outside off, a touch overpitched, and that's a proper stride forward from Foakes to drive to the right of mid-off
sharp turn from leg stump to outside leg, goes back, thinks about flicking, decides to leave in the end
full on middle and off, clipped back to the bowler
length ball outside off, defended with an open face to the left of backward point
looks to whip a shortish ball against the turn from outside off, middles it, but can't beat short leg
fuller, closer to off stump, defended back to the bowler
tossed up slower outside off, gets forward to defend square on the off side
tossed up full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
flat length ball sliding on towards off stump, gets forward, lets it come, and defends square on the off side
tossed up around off, stretches out and drives smoothly wide of mid-off
looped up around off, dips, draws a leading edge to mid-off
on a length and outside off, tip and run to the covers
full and spins in at off, much slower through the air, forward and smothered
another stock ball from Kuldeep, but a bit too full and straight, neatly clipped through midwicket off the front foot
Kuldeep goes full and shifts his lines wider of off, so Pope goes low and sweeps it over square leg. He sees the wider line and brings out the sweep

first-ball wicket at home for Siraj! Wow, Pant throws himself to his left like a goalkeeper and plucks it out with one hand. Pant draws big cheers from the Chepauk crowd. Slightly short and slanting down the leg side with that angle, Pope can't get enough bat on it and tickles it behind. Pant athletic intervention provides India the breakthrough. It popped out of the webbing once Pant landed on his elbow, but he just about clings onto it. He has Chepauk chanting: Rishabh Pant! Rishabh Pant! Rishabh Pant!
Moeen rides the bounce and guides this short ball to point
on a length and outside off, defended
dug in short and slanting away outside off, Moeen shoulders arms
back of a length and finishes wider than a set of stumps outside off, ignored
Moeen jumps back to this short ball on middle and defends to cover. Siraj begins with a wicket-maiden at home
tossed outside off and spins in, Foakes stretches out to smother it
more spin for Kuldeep from wide of the crease, defended on middle
on a length and rips back in from outside off, blocked to the leg side
on a length and spins in sharply at off, blocked to the left of short leg
tossed up higher and spins in at off, dead-batted to the leg side
shorter and spins in, Foakes pulls firmly off the back foot, Agarwal, subbing for Pujara, takes evasive action and cops a blow on his back
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, Moeen is half-forward as he guides the ball to point
back of a length and swerves away outside off, Siraj has Moeen reaching out for the ball with his hands and beating the outside edge
on a length and bends away outside off, beating the outside edge once again, as Moeen hangs his bat out in the channel
full on a fourth-stump line, defended to cover
shorter and outside off, run away to point
full and bending in on middle from around the wicket, Moeen keeps it out
pushed through and straightens around middle and off, defended
shorter and outside off, jabbed past the bowler off the back foot
tossed up just a shade outside off, hint of spin in, defended back
chipped with the spin to the right of midwicket
dangled up invitingly outside off and spins away beautifully, Moeen doesn't bite
floated up and drifts into leg stump, draws a leading edge to the right of Agarwal at silly-point
on a length and bends in at middle, worked to short midwicket
lifter, slanting down the leg side, as Foakes ducks under it
kicks up from a back of a length, Foakes glides it to the right of gully with soft hands
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, Foakes is right forward to play it back to the bowler
back of a length and heading down the leg side, away from the reach of Foakes' flick, good take from Pant down the leg side
on a length and sliding into the hips, kisses the thigh pad and rolls away between keeper and leg slip for four leg byes
tossed up on middle, not much turn, defended back to Kuldeep
on a length and spins away outside off, Moeen goes back and jabs to cover
dropped shorter and wider of off, Moeen rocks back and cuts it hard through backward point. Gets off the mark after 16 balls
fuller and slower on the pads, knocked defensively to midwicket
full and quickish spin for Kuldeep, attacking the stumps, defended to short leg with soft hands
turn for Kuldeep, of the slower variety and the bounce is sharper, as Foakes is caught in a tangle and struck on the thigh pad
bouncer outside off from around the wicket, Moeen watches it before swaying his upper body out of the way
Moeen gets right behind the line of this shortish ball on a fourth-stump line, and fends it back to Siraj
back of a length and outside off, punched on the up to backward point, where Kuldeep makes a tumbling save to his left
good length on off, defended off the back foot
fuller on the stumps, played back to the bowler
short and angling across off, Moeen drops his gloves and lets it pass
pushed through on off, defended with soft hands to the off side
on a length and spins in towards off, blocked to cover

quicker, sharper turn for Ashwin. The length is fuller, but Foakes elects to play back. Not given out lbw, and Ashwin coaxes Kohli into a review once again. Rips ack in to hit the front pad above the knee-roll. UltraEdge confirms that there's no inside edge but it seems to be spinning down the leg side. Another good call from umpire Menon
on a length and breaks in, kicks up, disturbing the surface. Foakes is surprised by the extra bounce as he looks to fend it away
on a length again, Foakes plays for offbreak, but this slides straight on and beats the outside edge
fuller on middle, swept away for one
a bit too full and angling into middle, too straight in line as well, sweetly clipped away through midwicket. First runs off Siraj after four successive maidens, including a wicket-maiden
back of a length and swerves in, turned through midwicket
on a length and around off, defended
full on off, blocked back to Siraj
on a length and slanting away outside off, jabbed to mid-off off the inside half
full on the stumps, Moeen hangs back and pushes it back to Siraj
pushed through on middle, blocked to short leg
tossed outside off, Foakes stretches out to smother it
flatter and around off, whipped to mid-on
flighted on off, Moeen bends forward in defence
shorter, flatter, worked through square leg

edged, hits Pant's pad, into the hands of Rahane lunging forward from slip. On a length, and sliding away outside off to take the outside edge. The ball hits Pant's left thigh pad and Rahane catches it on the rebound even as the ball dies on him
drifts in from wide of the crease and spins away sharply past the bat
darted on middle, clipped away wide of short leg
full and outside off, defended to the right of silly point
on a length and slides back in at off, Foakes covers up in defence
fizzes in off the pitch, bounces, goes back and stabs it to the off side
on a length and rips in from outside off, extra bounce too, and it bounces out of Pant's gloves as Stone tries to leave it alone. Looks like it hit Stone's glove as he was withdrawing his bat there
chipped straight to Rohit at short midwicket. Full offbreak, spins in at off stump, Stone pushes forward and picks out the fielder
nicely flighted on off stump, gets forward and blocks with the stone to the squarer of the silly points
nice length, spinning away from middle stump, keeps his pad out of the line and defends to the squarer of the silly points
quicker, slides on with the angle. Goes back to work it leg side and is hit on the thigh pad
flights this outside off and he gets forward to defend into the point region
flat, angling into the stumps, no turn. Goes back to flick, gets hit on the pad
skiddy, straightening slightly towards middle stump, goes back to keep it out and gets a thick inside edge into his back pad
tossed up slower outside off, gets forward to defend, and squeezes it wide of slip with the outer half of his bat
stays round the wicket, slants it across to the left-hander's off stump, goes back and defends towards silly point
fuller, around off stump, gets forward and defends to silly point
a bit slower, more turn to straighten in towards off stump, gets right back to defend towards point
nicely bowled, drifts out and turns ever so slightly towards off stump, goes back and blocks to silly point
tossed up just outside off, skips out and clips into the on side
tossed up just outside off stump, good stride forward to clip with the turn through midwicket
flighted, drifts outside leg stump and spins towards middle and off, good stride forward to defend with the turn
a toiuch shorter, spins towards off stump, gets right back to defend
fuller, slower, pitching on middle and leg, good stride forward once more to block to silly point
full on middle and off, big stretch out to defend with the turn, square on the off side
flat length ball speared into the pads, goes back to clip watchfully into the leg side
tossed up outside off, good stride forward to push towards mid-off
length ball, keeps going straight just outside off, goes deep in his crease to defend into the on side
a touch wider, spins in more, goes right back once more to defend with soft hands. Pant exhorts Axar to pitch it further up
more flight now and Leach jumps out, reaches the pitch, and lofts it cleanly over mid-off. He's looked impressive in defence, and this is a decisive attacking shot too
down the track to the flighted ball on middle and off, clips watchfully to short midwicket
goes a little more round-arm, gets it to drift slightly as it loops onto a leg-stump line. Defended towards short leg
tossed up slow again, pitching just outside leg, swept to deep backward square leg
quickish length ball on off stump, defended to point
tossed up full on leg stump, and the ball dips and holds on the pitch a little as Leach looks to drive. Hangs in the air briefly before reaching mid-off
sharp, sharp turn from outside off as Leach misses the sweep. Ricochets off Pant's glove and Rahane dives left to catch it at slip
full outside off, nice stride out to punch to short extra-cover
angled down the leg side, goes back and works it towards long leg
full, close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
better length, spinning in from just outside off, gets forward and blocks with soft hands
slanted across, away from off stump, and it doesn't turn back as much as expected as he goes back to defend. Rolls away wide of slip off the outer half of the bat
length ball, slides on towards off stump. Half-forward to defend, and the ball rolls into the short fine leg region off the inside edge

lovely delivery, goes wide on the crease and angles a flighted ball in towards off stump. Beaten in the air by dip as he comes forward to flick, past the inside edge onto pad, but he's struck outside the line
looks to sweep from outside off, top-edges it but it lands safely in the backward square leg region
fullish on off and middle, defended to silly point
tossed up, lands slightly shorter and spins away from off stump. Gets a good stride forward and leaves it
a bit quicker on off stump, defended to silly point off the front foot
this one seemed to straighten towards off stump, possibly the carrom ball. Goes back to defend and gets a thick inside edge into his left boot
flat, round-arm, angling into the pads and not turning too much, goes back to work it through square leg
brings him forward to defend in front of middle and off. A bit of a puff of dust and the ball hits high on the inside half of the bat
a bit fuller, gets forward and defends into the off side
leg-stumpish line, draws him forward to defend it back down the pitch
quicker, angled across to off stump, goes deep in his crease and defends back down the pitch
slower, pitching just outside leg. Goes through his flick too quick, and the ball turns to beat both batsman and keeper. Pant was unsighted, and the ball spun a long way, in his defence

there's the length. Half-forward to defend one spinning in from outside off. Extra bounce, and it's off the glove, but between the two leg side catchers. Kohli dives left at leg gully but can't reach it
perfect length again. Brings Leach forward to defend outside off, and the ball rips past his outside edge
fuller, driven to the left of cover, and Axar puts in a dive to stop it
full on leg stump, jabbed back towards the bowler
slower, but just as full on middle and leg, gets his front leg out of the way to defend into the point region
tossed up on a good length, spinning away from off stump, defended with an open face towards backward point
full, a bit of late away reverse outside off, gets forward for a checked drive into the covers
length ball, closer to off stump, and again that late away shape. Pushes at it with slightly hard hands, but keeps the edge down towards gully

finds the edge again, and this one runs away to the left of the diving Rohit at gully. Beautiful bowling, beautiful length in the corridor. Again it goes towards the shiny side, but this time off the seam. Foakes defends, plays with soft hands, and the edge rolls away along the floor

inswing this time, and Foakes seems to be prepared for it, staying slightly leg-side of the ball while looking to drive into the covers. No real stride forward, though, and a thick edge runs away wide of gully

and he gets his man immediately. Another acrobatic grab from Pant, diving full-length to his left to take it one-handed. This is superlative bowling, angling into the fourth-stump channel, forcing Leach to play, and the length means his feet go nowhere. Just pushes at it, and the ball straightens away and takes a thick edge. Pant had to go for that, because the only slip was a wide slip.
and he bowls his stock ball to left-handers. Angling into the fourth-stump channel, then leaving the batsman. Broad pokes and misses, no footwork
dips onto a lovely length outside off, and Foakes gets forward to defend and is beaten by turn and bounce. Hit on the pad, but struck outside the line
a touch short outside off, punched away through point
nicely flighted outside off, blocked back to the bowler
down the track to a tossed-up ball outside off, clipped to long-on

he doesn't need any fielders, really. Full, too full to sweep, and too straight. He barely manages to get all the way down, and just about manages a bottom-edge into his stumps. Second consecutive five-for for Ashwin, he's bowled beautifully through this series so far. And he leads India off the field and gets a warm reception from his home crowd
fullish outside off, defended into the point region
back of a length on off stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length outside off, left alone
full on leg stump, clipped away to the left of long leg
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length, closer to off stump, punched back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, defended with soft hands into the off side
a bit wider, and more turn, good stride forward to defend into the cover point region
quicker length ball outside off, blocked towards backward point
tossed up slower, wide-ish line, left alone

down the track, and Gill gets his first runs of the match with a slightly miscued shot. Tossed up wider outside off than he wants. He's looking to hit over the covers or mid-off, ends up slicing it over the point region
quicker, angling into the stumps, no turn, goes back and defends to short leg
back of a length, fifth-stump line, left alone
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length, a touch too wide to make Rohit play
short, only gets up to chest height over off stump, and that's not a good place to bowl to Rohit. Shifts his weight back, swivels, and pulls it up and over the backward square leg boundary
back of a length outside off, punched to short cover
tossed up slow outside off, defended to short cover
a touch too full on off stump to trouble Gill, blocked gently into the covers
slower, wider, draws Gill forward to block into the cover point region
full, a bit quicker, angling into leg stump. Gets a little tangled up with his foot going forward and across. Jams down in defence and inside-edges into pad
a touch shorter on off stump, goes back to chop into the point region
a bit of flight outside off stump, and Gill steps out to loft over mid-off. Doesn't time it as sweetly as he'd like, but it easily clears the man
slightly short and outside off, Rohit is in position quickly. He shifts back and delectably drives to the left of cover after opening the bat-face. Top shot from a top batsman
pushed through on the leg stump, Rohit goes low and sweeps it behind square
flighted and spins in from outside off, Gill inches forward and seems to have inside-edged it onto his pad
belted over the long-on boundary. Pushed through flatter and quicker on off stump, down the track, gets close to the pitch and launches it with the spin over mid-on for six
full and slides in towards off stump, Rohit is forward to smother it
full on middle, Gill sweeps straight to backward square leg
did Rohit nick that? Deemed byes. Dangled up outside off, drifts in and spins away past the outside edge, and defeats Foakes as well
full on middle, blocked back to Leach
pushed through on off stump, Rohit is right forward to keep that out
slower through the air, on a length on off, Rohit allows the ball to come onto him, then opens the bat-face and dinks it to point
full and straight, swept to backward square
on a length and spins in, worked away behind square
pushed down to long-on
worked with the spin behind square on the leg side
Rohit uses his feet and kicks it away with his pad

Rohit wants a single, but is sent back by Gill. He undoes his steps and dishes out a full-length dive. Has he made his ground in time? Yes Flighted and spins away outside off, opens the face, drives towards backward point and sets off. He turns around and the dive saves him
tossed up on off stump, Rohit presses forward to defend this
edged, but does not carry to Stokes at slip. On a length, angling in and spinning away, Rohit prods at it but the ball bounces in front of Stokes
on a length and outside off, Rohit drops down to one knee and sweeps flat and hard to deep square leg's left
full on off, blocked off the front foot
full and outside off, bunted to short midwicket off the front foot

a rare error from Foakes. He has missed a stumping chance. Rohit ventures down the track, Moeen drags his length back. Finds turn and bounce. Rohit swings and misses. Foakes is beaten to his left as the ball pops out of his gloves
pushed through on middle, defended off the front foot
darted into off stump, dead-batted away
shoots low outside off, sneaks under Rohit's bat, and beats Foakes once again
full and drifts in on middle, pushed back to him
down the track and stabbed to point
full, grips, and turns, Rohit pokes it out to point
Rohit advances at Leach, he drags his length back and shifts his lines wider of off, run away to short third man
pushed back to the bowler
flighted and spins away outside off, left alone
on a length and just a shade outside off, blocked off the front foot
tossed up outside off, Gill stretches out and sweeps. He does not get hold of the shot but hits it over Leach at backward square leg
full and spins in from outside off, Gill keeps it out
down the track and whipped to short midwicket
full on off, Gill uses his feet and plays it back to the bowler
tossed up and spinning down the leg side, Gill doesn't connect with a sweep, Foakes can't gather it either as the ball rolls away fine. 3 leg byes
full on off, pushed back to Leach

an appeal for lbw, and Gill has been given out by umpire Menon. Gill has a chat with Rohit and calls for a review. Quickish slider from Leach, strikes the front pad in line with middle before the ball hits the bat. Looks pretty adjacent. It would've crashed into leg stump and Gill has to go
tossed up on middle, Pujara shuffles across and defends to the leg side
short and spins away outside off, Pujara jumps back and cuts it between point and covers
skidder on off, hurries Rohit into a defensive jab to point
sliding into the pads, picked off to square leg
tossed up outside off, Moeen gets it to grip, turn, and bounce. Rohit does not connect with a sweep, the ball seems to have ballooned off the glove into the grille of the helmet

full, starts outside off and spins in, Rohit hides the bat behind his pad and does not play at it. Impact seems outside the line but that does not matter as Rohit doesn't play at it. Hits the front pad and rolls to the covers. Not given out lbw, and England choose to challenge the on-field not-out decision. The TV umpire reckons Rohit has offered a shot and says impact outside off. Quite bizarre. Root isn't pleased one bit. Would it have hit the stumps? Ball-tracking suggests it would have struck middle stump
down the track and forced to midwicket
on a length and drifts away outside off, jabbed to the covers
flighted on middle, defended back

another big appeal for lbw, umpire Menon raises his finger this time. Pushed through, straightens along off and middle, Rohit brings out the reverse-sweep and is hit on the back pad. UltraEdge detects a spike. Rohit has nicked it and umpire Menon's on-field out call has been reversed
clipped to the right of midwicket
tossed up outside off, padded away
full and outside off, defended
short and outside off, goes on the back foot and lashes it away behind point for four
Rohit uses his feet, is beaten in flight, hides the bat behind his pad and keeps it out
uses his feet and pads it away as this is fired well outside off
tossed up outside off, swept flat and hard to deep midwicket
Pujara now uses his feet, Leach drags his length back. He puts his bat behind the pad as the ball loops back
Pujara steps out again, pushed through outside off, padded away
full on middle, worked through square leg
down the track and pushed to mid-on
on a length, turn and bounce outside off, Rohit shoulders arms

this is a beauty from Leach. Nice and full, drags Rohit forward and then grips and turns past the outside edge. Foakes rides the bounce and takes the bails off. Is Rohit's back foot on the line? Seems like some part of it is behind the line and Rohit survives
down the track and drilled to cover
Pujara skips out and pushes to mid-on
on a length and spins in, defensively pushed back to the bowler
on a length and pushed across off, blocked to cover
floated up on middle, Rohit opens the face and defends with soft hands just wide of silly-point
Rohit steps out, offers a shot, blocking wide of silly-point once again
full on off, run away to the left of silly-point this time
Rohit jumps down the track, meets it on the full, and turns this off-stump ball to the right of mid-on
fractionally short and sliding in at off stump, Pujara is right back to block it stoutly
looped up on off stump, Pujara stretches out to smother it
goes back to one that keeps a little low as it spins in towards off stump, clipped into the square leg region to take India's lead to 250
length ball spinning sharply down leg, Pujara misses the front-foot flick
down the track, gets to the pitch of this off-stumpish ball and clips to backward sqare leg
quickish on off stump, goes back and defends into the off side
down the track as Moeen flights this wider outside off, blocked to short midwicket

wow, what a way to go. Out of his crease to the pitch of the ball again, the line is a big straighter, flicks it into the ground and it bounces up to short leg, who immediately flicks to the keeper to try and catch Pujara out of his ground. And it's mighty close, because Pujara jams his bat into the ground a centimeter out of his crease, then loses his grip on his bat just before he can drag it in. He tries to scramble in with his foot, but he just about fails to do so before Foakes disturbs the stumps
full, angling in past leg stump, clipped to short fine leg
back of a length, skids on towards off stump, defended into the off side
skips out but can't reach the pitch of this ball outside off, jams down in defence and gets a thick edge that bounces down towards slip
length ball straightening towards leg stump, presses forward to clip watchfully into the leg side
tossed up full, leg-stumpish. Looks to flick, and the ball goes straighter than he intends, towards mid-on off the outside half of his bat
quick length ball on leg stump, defended into the on side
flat length ball spinning in towards leg stump, goes back and defends into the on side
turn and bounce from just outside off as Kohli looks to get forward to defend. Past his inside edge to hit him on the body
big stretch out to the flighted ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
a touch short, rocks back to pull, but the ball keeps a little low and hits his upraised front leg outside the line of leg stump
tossed up wider, good stride out to defend into the cover region
tossed up full outside off, presses forward and blocks into the covers

has Leach dismissed Rohit with another ripper here? It's gone up to the third umpire... Tossed up beautifully on middle stump, gets Rohit stretching forward to defend. Then it dips and spins past his outside edge as he reaches for the ball, and there's plenty of bounce too. Foakes gathers it a foot or so above the stumps, and takes the bails off in a flash. Is Rohit's toe on the line? I can't see anything behind the line. The toe seems to be slightly in front of the line, in fact, when viewed from square on the leg side. Great work from Foakes, superb bowling from Leach
steps out to one slanted across, doesn't turn back that much from outside off as Pant steps out. Stretches out to push into the cover point region
goes deep in his crease to a length ball on off stump, punches to cover point
flighted and full on leg stump, stretches out and smothers it nicely
tossed up just outside off, big stretch out to block into the off side
back of a length, spinning away from the stumps, goes back and across to block into the covers
flat, angling into leg stump, goes back to defend into the on side
looks to sweep from outside off, and only manages a top edge. Hangs in the air for a long time, but it lands safely to the left of the man at backward square leg
tossed up on middle stump, good stride forward to block back down the pitch
back of a length, spinning away from off stump, goes back to jab towards backward point
quickish length ball close to off stump, defended off the front foot, into the covers
flat, spins from leg to off, goes right back to get on top of the bounce and defend to short leg
full outside off, driven towards cover point
low full-toss on leg stump, whipped to backward square leg
nice take from Foakes as this one jumps and turns away outside off, Kohli leaves alone.
tossed up slow on middle and leg, presses forward to block towards silly point
sharp turn from an off-stumpish line. Kohli gets forward, looks to defend with a slightly open face, and the ball zips past his outside edge
goes right back to one that straightens towards middle and leg, works it to backward square leg
back of a length, spinning away from off stump, goes right back for a push to the left of backward point. Soft hands, and Kohli's call from the non-striker's end was instantaneous
big, ripping turn from outside off to miss leg stump. Great take again from Foakes, after Kohli goes back and across and misses the flick
tossed up a bit fuller, similar line, gets forward to clip around the corner to backward square leg
length ball on off stump, gets his head over the ball to clip to backward square leg

goes deep in his crease this time, the length was similar but perhaps this was bowled a bit slower, so he had a fraction of a second more. Allows himself the room and time to work this off his stumps, with the turn, fine of that man at backward square leg
tossed up on off stump, big stretch out to block it back to the bowler
goes right back to this one pitched outside off, blocks with the turn to short leg
tossed up slightly slower outside off, and he stretches out for the sweep. Ends up gloving it fine, over the keeper's gloves

got him, Pant falls in an attempt to take on Leach. Tossed up slow outside off, and Pant fails to reach the pitch of it. Looks to hit it with the turn over long-on or deep midwicket, but it turns more than he expects, past his inside edge. That's a very hard shot to pull off consistently on a turning pitch. A word on Foakes too, because that spun past leg stump, and he made the stumping look routine. Outstanding work again
fired in flat on middle stump, gets forward and blocks into the on side
sharp turn away from off stump, quick too, and Rahane can't really get forward to defend. Past his outside edge
short, and the turn ends up making Rahane reach out for the cut. He can't keep it down, and the ball lands just short of Stone falling forward at backward point
flight, dip and turn from wide outside off, stretches out to defend, and the ball is past his inside edge to hit pad. Impact is outside the line, though
flighted again, fuller this time, uses his wrists to whip that to mid-on from wide of off
short, and Kohli jumps back to pull, but he can't beat the man at square midwicket diving to his left

goes right back to a length ball spinning into the stumps, back foot almost touching the stumps, and that gives him the time to work it fine. Seemed to come off his bat, right off the middle in fact, but leg byes given. If that had actually hit his pad, he might have been lbw, because I don't think that was spinning enough to miss leg stump
full and flighted wide of off, looks for the cover drive and it rolls back to the bowler off the inside edge
back and across to one spinning in from outside off, clips to short leg

not short or wide enough to cut, but Rahane is looking to create scoring opportunities before the unplayable ball comes along. Doesn't turn as much as he expects, and he bottom-edges it. Hits Foakes' gloves and pops out, but it would be harsh to call it a chance
fuller, blocked into the covers
length ball on off stump, gets a good stride forward to block it back
tossed up full outside off, and it stops on Kohli as he reaches out to drive. In the air, but it eludes Rory Burns' dive to his left at short extra-cover. Hit his fingertips, in fact
tossed up, spinning away from off, looks to sweep and gets a bottom edge that rolls into the short fine leg region
goes right back to a quick length ball close to off stump, defends to silly point
flighted ball wide of off, stretches out to defend and it spins past his inside edge to hit pad, but well outside the line
down the track to the flighted ball on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
ooh, that was short enough to cut, but the ball spins back far too much, from not too wide outside off. Bottom-edges it into his back thigh
full-toss on off stump, and Rahane gratefully accepts it to punch between cover and mid-off. Every run is precious on this pitch
short, genuine long-hop, turning down leg, and Rahane swivels and pulls into the gap to the left of deep square leg. Pope did very well to duck out of the way just in time at short leg
steps out to one tossed up outside off, doesn't get to the pitch, and has to stretch out to keep it out
tossed up on off stump, stretches out and defends with an open face to backward point
tossed up on off stump, and Kohli plays with a closed face, looking to clip it into the leg side. Leading edge flies past silly point
similar ball, but this time he stretches out and smothers it with a defensive full face
quick length ball outside off, left alone

tossed up slow outside off, stretches out, defends with an open face and soft hands, and manages to steer the ball wide of slip. Stone chases back from backward point, looks to pull it back with a slide, but fails to get his hands to the ball
quick turn from off stump, goes back and jabs into the off side, to the right of silly point
tossed up outside off, steps out and defends to short extra-cover
tossed up wider now, big stretch out to defend from close to the pitch, but still the ball turns enough to hit the inside half of the bat and roll towards short leg

gone, is it? Yup. Looks to step out, but can't reach the pitch of this dipping one outside off. Bounces up sharply, and he gets a thick inside edge into his pad as he lunges towards the ball to defend. Lobs up into the leg side, and Pope takes it diving forward from short leg
quick length ball on off stump, gets forward and defends with the turn
short, rocks back and slaps to short extra-cover. Stopped on him, so he hit it straighter than he may have intended
full on middle and leg, defended towards short leg
short, wide, cut away between backward point and cover point. It spun a long way, so he reached out and focused more on placement than power
tossed up outside off, stretches out to defend, and the inside edge rolls away into the midwicket region
a touch short, spinning away from the stumps, and Kohli goes right back in his crease to whip it wide of mid-on
tossed up on off stump, big stretch forward to smother it and block it back to Leach
tossed up, too full on middle and leg, and Kohli whips it away to the left of mid-on. Top shot
tossed up full on leg stump, clipped towards midwicket
full and flighted on off stump, gets forward to defend into the on side

nice length close to off stump, spins away sharply as he comes forward to defend, the edge rolls away to the right of backward point. Axar's bat came down at an angle there, slicing across the ball slightly
turns in from wide outside off, goes back and across to defend with the turn
tossed up, spinning from off to leg, gets forward and uses his wrists to play that watchfully into the backward square leg region
goes right back now, to work this with the turn, meets it in front of off stump and plays it to the fielder at backward square leg
sharp turn from middle stump and finishes outside leg, looks to flick, gets a thick inside edge into the ground
pushed through, spins in from outside off, worked wide of short leg
slides in from outside off, Axar has a short stride, doesn't turn as much as Axar expects it to and beats him on the outside edge
tossed up on off stump, forward and smothered
full on off stump, Axar gets forward and runs it with soft hands just wide of slip
on a length, drifts in from around the wicket and spins sharply past the outside edge. Foakes rides the bounce superbly and collects the ball
fuller than a good length and kicks past the outside edge once again
another one that zips past the outside edge. Foakes continues to be brilliant behind the stumps
tossed up on the rough, Axar gets forward and plays it back to Moeen
fractionally short and sliding in at the stumps, Axar picks the length fairly early. He jumps back and whips it with the wrists to the right of short leg. Well played
on a length and just a shade outside off, blocked back to the bowler
flighted and outside off, blocked to the off side
pushed to the covers off the back foot
tossed outside off, not much spin, Kohli stretches out and guides to point
fuller and spins away outside off, Kohli does well not to jab at it. He feels for the ball and then belatedly tucks his bat inside the line
Leach floats a full-toss on middle, Kohli brings his bat hand into play and shovels it away to the left of square leg and helps himself to a boundary. India's lead passes 300

Moeen belts out an appeal for lbw, and that's given by Sharma. Pushed through from around the wicket, on a length and straightens to beat Axar on the defensive front-foot push and hit him on the back pad. No bat involved and it looks adjacent. The tracker returns umpire's call on middle stump. Umpire Sharma's call is upheld
very full and outside off, Ashwin lunges forward and drives it back to the bowler
full and Moeen shifts his lines wider of off, Ashwin stretches out, goes low, and sweeps flat and hard to the midwicket boundary. Another puff of dust from the surface
dipping offbreak, messes with Ashwin's drive as an inside edge wanders away to midwicket
shorter and turning in from outside off, Ashwin camps back and punches to midwicket
on a length and much wider of off, Ashwin ventures a reverse-sweep, ends up splicing the the ball in the air to the right of slip. Stokes chases hard
darted short and wide outside off, the poor length allows Kohli to go deep in the crease and crack it away to the right of backward point for four
fuller on off, Kohli is now right forward to block it to covers
starts around middle and spins away, Kohli is back, but adjusts and blocks to cover
shorter and outside off, Kohli plays so very late and dabs it to the right of slip
starts outside off and fizzes away further, Ashwin leaves this length ball outside off
tossed up at off stump, Ashwin bends forward in defence
pushed through on off, Kohli stretches out and blocks
chipped in the air to the left of short leg as Root gets it to straighten from around the wicket
fired on the pads, picked off to the right of midwicket
shorter on middle, blocked off the back foot
bunted down to mid-off
Root draws a leading edge but it does not carry to cover
Kohli hangs his bat inside the line after pressing forward, this length ball spins away sharply into Foakes' gloves
pushed through outside off, Kohli lunges forward and tips a single into the cover-point region
shooter, keeps low and spins away outside off. Ashwin digs it out to the covers
tossed up, dips just a shade outside off and spins away past Ashwin's big slog-sweep

shot, Ashwin! Tossed up on middle stump, Ashwin uses his feet, gets close to the pitch, and simply chips it over Broad at mid-on. The fielder chases hard, slides at the boundary, and manages to haul the ball into play
on a length and just outside off, a Williamson-like late-dab to short third man is Kohli's response
quick and sliding across off, Ashwin jabs from the crease and almost drags it back onto the stumps
pushed through on leg stump, swept from the stumps through square leg
on a length and angling away outside off, steadily defended to cover
skidding into middle, Ashwin gets forward and blocks it back to the bowler
darted on leg stump, Ashwin goes low, and sweeps straight to backward square leg. A fumble gives him a single and the strike
pushed through outside off, this non-turner is bunted to short cover off the front foot
slower through the air, Leach holds this one back, defended on middle stump off the front foot
dangled up invitingly on middle, Ashwin backs away outside leg and scoops it away to the left of the bowler. Nearly a return catch
darted flatter and quicker on the off stump, Ashwin brings out the sweep again, this time he drags it away to the left of backward square leg and the leg umpire for four
shorter on middle and leg, Ashwin is right back to force the ball away between deep midwicket and long-on
much fuller, starts on off, and then rips away past the bat into the gloves of Foakes. The keeper rides the bounce and collects it cleanly once again
on a length and angling across off stump, resolutely defended to the covers
round-arm dart sliding across off, prodded to the covers again
pretty full on middle, shovelled with the bottom wrist to deep midwicket
looped up on leg stump, Ashwin sweeps and ends up dragging the ball over backward square leg
full and sliding in from around the wicket, bounces to catch Kohli in a tangle and hit the pad. It wasn't quite threatening the stumps
run away towards point
shorter and sliding in at off, Kohli goes right back and plays it back to him
full and on off, defended off the front foot
on a length and Leach finds spin, of the slower variety, blocked to cover
dangled up on off, Kohli stretches out to dead-bat it away
full and straight, tucked away to the right of long leg. Leach slides to his right and keeps it to three... or not. Leach's body is in contact with the ad board as he swats the ball into play
on a length and outside off, Ashwin reaches out, opens the face, and punches to backward point
on a length and outside off, guided to backward point once again
bounces from a length outside off, jabbed to the covers

edged and dropped by Stokes. He snatches at the ball from slip but it bursts out. Fuller and moves away outside off like a legcutter, Ashwin has a hard-handed jab at it and gets away. Stokes snatches at the ball to his left, and can't grab it
full on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
full and drifting across off, poked into the covers
floated up outside off, forward and smothered
sliding into the pads, duly put away fine of backward square leg. Moeen chases it in vain
tossed up and spins into middle, patted down to long-on
tossed up on middle, Ashwin shuffles across and dead-bats it away
back of a length legcutter outside off, left alone, good take from Foakes
fullish and largely holds its line outside off, Kohli opens the bat-face and dinks the ball to point
Kohli gets on top of a short ball outside off and taps it down to backward point
on a length and wide of off, nothing doing from Kohli
shorter and outside off, run away to the left of cover-point
back of a length and another cutter, finishes on off, Kohli gets behind the line and blocks carefully

lobbed up and spinning down the leg side, beating Ashwin, fine take from Foakes. Oh hang on, England review for caught behind. The ball disturbs the surface and fizzes down the leg side. Big splash but daylight between bat and ball. Umpire Menon's on-field call is right
full-toss outside off, pushed away to the left of mid-off
full and outside off, dinked square through the off side with an open face
overpitched and outside off, Ashwin opens the bat-face and drives the ball firmly behind point
on a length and dips sharply to ping the pad
slightly overpitched and outside off, Kohli stretches out, rolls his wrists and drives it through extra-cover
sharp turn from outside off, but short enough for Ashwin to go back and across and nurdle it to the left of backward square leg
tossed up wide of off, whipped down to long-on
slow flight wide of off, stretches out and smothers it nicely
goes on the back foot to this one spinning in from outside off, works it to backward square leg. Kohli wants a single, and he's rightly sent back
flighted ball fairly wide of off, big stretch out to defend, gets close to the pitch of it
a little more flight and a little fuller. Looks to drive through mid-off and ends up playing it to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
quick length ball on middle and leg, gets his front pad out of the way and defends with the turn
flighted, just outside off, big stretch out to defend into the off side
floated up towards leg stump, stretches out and blocks it back down the pitch
flat length ball straightening towards off stump, makes a bit of room and punches to deep point
flighted ball spinning from leg to off, gets a good stride in to defend, hits the outside half but he plays with soft hands and the ball rolls gently behind the wicket on the off side
quick, fires it into the pitch on an off-stump line. Sharp turn away, and Ashwin, going on the back foot, decides to leave it alone
goes right back to one spinning in from outside off, a bit of extra bounce as he looks to defend, hits him on the thigh pad

shot. He's been getting in that back-and-across shuffle to Moeen in this innings, to get himself outside off stump before the bowler releases, and closer to the line of the flighted ball wide of off. Similar ball to the one that got him out in the first innings, but he stretches out, gets right to the pitch, and drives it wide of mid-off
quicker length ball, gets forward and defends into the on side
straighter, looks to go back and work it away, spins sharply and hits his thigh pad
tossed up outside off, stretches out and defends into the off side
flighted ball on off stump, gets forward to clip watchfully to short leg
back of a length, off-stumpish line, goes back and defends with the turn into the covers
goes on the back foot again though the length is a bit fuller, rides the bounce well and plays it down towards gully
tossed up wide of off, steps out and thrusts his pad at the ball. It's spinning away so he can do that without any worries
goes right back to a length ball spinning away from off stump, and he's in a good position to use his wrists and play it into the mid-on region
back of a length, turning away from off stump, gets on the back foot to punch into the covers
goes back to a length ball spinning from middle to off, clips to midwicket

steps out to a tossed-up ball wide of off stump, pads it away into the off side. Pitched too wide to be threatening the stumps. He had bat and pad close together so it may have hit part of his bat too. Given as runs
goes back to try and work it behind square. Spins sharply down leg and beats his inside edge. Another good take from Foakes
sharp turn and bounce from outside off, quite slow initially, and Kohli stretches out to defend and inside-edges into his front pad
quickerr, goes back and works it into the on side
shot. Tossed up slow outside off, and Kohli plants his front leg to the leg side of the ball to make room for the sweep in the air over backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, goes back and defends to midwicket
back of a length, straightening on off stump, goes back and defends into the cover point region
steps out, gets to the pitch of this middle-stump ball, and clips gently through midwicket
tossed up outside off, big stretch out again to defend into the covers
a touch too full on middle and leg, whipped to the right of mid-on
sharp turn from a middle-and-leg line. Bounce too. Goes back, looks to play with a closed face into the leg side, and the ball pops up to hit his glove, flies wide of slip though
full on middle and leg, gets his pad out of the way and defends into the covers

back of a length, quite wide of off, no real turn, goes deep in his crease and works it away through square leg to bring up a masterful half-century on a square turner. Superb innings, one of his best in these sorts of conditions
tossed up outside off, quite slow, and that allows Ashwin to sweep it to deep backward square leg despite the ball being a touch fuller than a traditional sweeping length
quick length ball spinning in towards off stump, defends with soft hands wide of slip
back of a length, spinning in from fairy wide of off stump. Goes right back to work it to deep backward square leg
tossed up slow, wide of off, shuffles out, gets close to the pitch, and pushes into the cover point region
turn and bounce from outside off, but the length allows Kohli to go back and control it reasonably well. Works it in the air, but into the gap to the right of short leg
tossed up on off stump, gets forward and defends into the point region with an open face
full on off stump, presses forward and smothers it
tossed up on off stump, better length than the previous ball, defended to cover point
goes right back to a quick length ball spinning away from off stump, punches it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, steps back and across to punch towards mid-on
tossed up full on off stump, pushed gently to the left of mid-off, and they run the quick single with Broad having to move away from his throwing side
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
fullish, angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball angling into off stump, steps across and clips to midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, shuffles across and tucks it to the left of long leg. Superb use of the wrists, and he always knew there was two available
back of a length, slightly wider outside off, steps across and dabs to point with an open face
shortish in the corridor, opens his bat face and steers to point
full outsde off, defended into the point region

oh my, that has turned 90 degrees. Sharp bounce too, and Ashwin can only prop forward and watch it turn away without really attempting a shot. Foakes casually sticks out his right glove and catches it
short, wide, slapped away to the right of backward point. Poor ball
fired in full on leg stump, blocked into the on side
slow, turns from leg to off, goes right back to defend into the on side
length ball straightening towards off stump, goes right back to defend into the covers
back of a length, straightens along a line tight on off stump, gets on top of the bounce and defends into the point region
back of a length close to off stump, defended back to the bowler
hip-high full-toss on leg stump, tucked away to long leg
what a shot that is. Short, rising over his right shoulder, and he opens up and plays a tennis smash straight of mid-on. Wow

short again, outside off, makes room and plays another tennis shot, a sort of inside-out smash this time, and finds the cover point boundary to bring up a sensational half-century. Big ovation from his home fans, and he turns and raises his bat to every stand
short, well down leg, steps across to try and whip it away, but it's too far from him to make contact
back of a length, spinning away from off stump, goes right back to defend into the off side
fuller, more flight, on middle and off, stretches out and defends it back to the bowler
back of a length, spinning into a wider line, goes back and punches towards point
tossed up, maybe a touch too full to trouble Kohli on an off stump line. Big stride forward to block square on the off side
now he drops short, and Kohli steps back to open his bat face and steer between backward point and cover point
a bit of dip, spinning away from off stump, Kohli gets forward and uses his hands to play slightly away from his body but defend with full control into the cover point region
shortish, down leg, can't connect with the flick off the hip after stepping across to the off side
short, gets up around his right shoulder, and he opens out fully to play another tennis swat down to wide long-on
short, angling away from off stump, thinks about the pull but decides against it and leaves
short, gets up to chest height over middle stump, pulled to deep backward square leg
back of a length on leg stump, tucked into the backward square leg region. Thinks of a single, but the square leg fielder moves quickly to his right to deny him
back of a length, slanting away from off stump, punched to the right of point
back of a length, spinning in from outside off, steps back to work it through backward square leg
tossed up outside off, nice stride forward to block it back down the pitch, with the turn
good length outside off, and Ashwin doesn't get fully forward on this occasion. Spins in to beat his inside edge and hit pad, well outside the line. A bit of extra bounce too on this occasion
goes back to a length ball spinning in towards leg stump, clips it smartly to deep backward square leg
back of a length fairly wide of off, steps back and across and dabs into the point region
back of a length outside off, back and across to clip to midwicket
pitched up and holds its line on middle, driven right back to Broad, who goes low and makes a half-save
full and dips off the rough patch outside off, legcutter from Broad, zips past the outside edge
Broad draws a leading edge but it balloons to the right of Pope at short cover. Looks like another cutter, Ashwin eyes up the leg side and nearly spoons it to the diving Pope
back of a length and skidding in towards off stump, Ashwin jabs his bat down. Broad draws an inside edge that dribbles past leg stump this time
Kohli rides the bounce of this shortish delivery outside off and glides it towards point
another one that seems to bounce from a length outside off, Kohli jumps on top of it and rides it out to point
Ashwin stretches out to take a full-toss from outside off and sweep it away firmly towards deep square leg. Wide line, and swept away square
a bit too full and wide of off, Kohli reaches out for the ball, rolls his wrists, and shovels it to extra-cover
shorter, starts outside off and breaks back in, the length allows Kohli to jump back and punches it strongly through midwicket
dangled up outside off, Moeen draws Ashwin forward into a push to mid-off
on a length and spins in towards the off stump, Ashwin goes back and serenely works a single through the leg side
flighted and outside off, eased with the spin to deep square leg
full and wobbles away into Foakes' gloves after beating Kohli's cover-drive
on a length and skidding through outside off, ignored. Good take from birthday boy Foakes standing up to the stumps
pitched up and homing in at off stump, Kohli deploys a decent stride and plays it up to short cover
slightly shorter and outside off, fended off into the covers
on a length and bounces into the safe hands of Foakes as Kohli ignores another one
good length and skipping through outside off, Kohli is happy to shoulder arms
on a length, pops up and bounces a lot at Ashwin, hits the shoulder of the bat/handle and drops into the pitch
flowing front-foot drive wide of cover from Ashwin
very full and sliding across off, Kohli gets forward to squirt it away to the covers

Mooen nabs Kohli for the second time in the match. Kohli calls for a review of the on-field out decision. On a length, Moeen gets this length ball to turn against the angle and bounce into the batsman. Kohli goes back and is pinged above the knee-roll of the front pad. Has Kohli nicked it or is this bouncing over the stumps? I think this will miss the stumps. Ultra Edge detects no edge and ooh the tracker returns umpire's call on middle stump. Clipping middle and enough for umpire Menon's original call to be upheld. Moeen ends an excellent innings from Kohli
loops a full-toss outside off, tapped to mid-off
slower through the air on middle, defended
nice and full, sliding in at off stump, defensively pushed back off the front foot
pitched up and slanting in at off stump, jabbed back to Broad off the front foot once again

another legcutter outside off, 132ks, Broad finds extra bounce and Ashwin's edge. Foakes, standing up to the stumps, drops a sharp chance as the ball bursts out before he could close his gloves around it. A rare error from Foakes

on a length and outside off, Broad finds Ashwin's outside edge once again, this streaks away between the keeper and short third man for four. Okay, replays indicate that Ashwin opened the face deliberately to run that away
back of a length and nips away like a legcutter, Ashwin opens the face deliberately once again, this is patted away square through the off side
glanced off the hips to long leg. Ashwin trusts Kuldeep and accepts the single on offer
floated up on leg stump, Kuldeep gets half-forward to defend
pushed through on middle, blocked off the front foot again
slower through the air on middle, Kuldeep is happy to dead-bat it to the leg side
tossed up liberally and spins away from the left-handed Kuldeep. He presses forward and drives through the line, picking the gap at extra-cover
on a length, angling in from round the wicket. Grips, turns and bounces past the outside edge after disturbing the surface

slides in from around the wicket, pins the pad, and the finger goes up. Kuldeep has asked for a review, but this seems fairly plumb. Nice and full, strikes the front pad below the knee-roll as Kuldeep pushes outside the line, probably playing for turn. No edge and that's clattering into leg stump. Another good call from umpire Menon
short and homes away outside off, stabbed down to third man. Ashwin keeps strike
on a length and on a fourth-stump line at 129ks, patted to the covers

what was that, Ashwin? He jumps across off and aims to scoop it over the keeper's head. 139ks, exposes his stumps. Ashwin doesn't touch it at all, Foakes can't gather it either. Deemed leg byes, though
fullish and around off, Ashwin gets forward and pushes it to the left of short cover
on a length and aiming for the top of off, Ashwin's tight forward-defensive push back to Broad intervenes
Ashwin rides the bounce of this shorter delivery outside off and runs it to point after opening the bat-face
tossed up and angling across off, a crease-bound Ishant jams his bat down and sends an inside edge that rolls past leg stump
on a length and sliding across off, Ishant goes back to defend it back
full and keeps low outside off, Ishant stoops low with it to keep it out
full and Moeen gets it to straighten along an off-stump line, defended back to him solidly
full and angling across off, Ishant inches forward and seems to have eked out an inside-edge onto his front pad
mighty full and drops on middle, dead-batted away as Ishant keeps out the over
on a length on off, Ashwin drives it on the up to mid-off. So easy on the eye, but he can't hit it in the gap
shortish and sliding into the hips, duly tucked away to long leg
back of a length and skidding in at off, some extra bounce for Broad. Ashwin is wary of it as he yanks his bottom hand off the handle and fends it off towards short cover
short and ducks in at the top of off to cramp Ashwin for room. He camps back and stabs it straight to short cover
on a length and curving into middle, Ashwin can't quite meet with a flick and wears it on his midriff
poetry in motion! On a length on middle, Ashwin stands up tall, shows the full face of the bat, and punches it straight of mid-on like a boss. He's the boss at Chepauk
tossed up on middle, hint of turn, Ishant bends forward and pops it to the right of short leg
sliding into off stump, forward and dead-batted away
skidding into middle, shoots low, Ishant plays back and keeps it out
darted across off, stabbed into the rough I think as the ball rolls back to the left of Moeen
Ishant shuffles across off, gets outside the line and misses this length-ball offbreak
tossed up outside off, Moeen held this back, so Ishant delays the drive and pushes it gently to the left of short cover
on a length and skidding in to keep low and beat Ashwin's jab. Top take from Foakes who is standing up to the stumps
on a length and just a shade outside off, opens the face, dinks it through point
short and slanting into the body, helped away with the angle off the back foot
yorker from Broad, bends in at middle, nearly has Ashwin toppling over, but the batsman manages to jam it out
shorter and outside off, jabbed away to deep third man
pretty full and outside off, squirted out to the covers
flat, on the pads, goes back and works it through square leg
back of a length on off stump, no real turn and slow off the pitch too. Gets on the back foot to push to the left of mid-off

missed stumping, wow. Kept low, in Foakes' defence. Steps out to try and launch this over long-on, but the ball didn't turn as much as expected, and skidded through low. Foakes was moving to his left, expecting more turn, and had to reach to his right with his gloves while also dipping at the knees because of the low bounce
tossed up on off stump, defended back to the bowler
down the track again, and this time he gets closer to the pitch of this off-stump ball. Doesn't really middle this big hit, lands it in the big gap between long-on and deep forward square leg
flat length ball spinning in towards off stump, goes right back to defend to short leg. May have kept a bit low, or it's just Ishant's height giving that impression
fullish, angling into the stumps, clipped to mid-on
full outside off, defended into the covers
length ball close to off stump, blocked into the covers
shot. Fullish outside off, gives Ashwin the room to extend his arms through a straight drive and loft it down the ground, to the right of mid-off. Finishes with left elbow nice and high
crisp timing. Length ball angling into middle and leg, clipped to the left of deep square leg
shot. Full, angling into the pads, clipped to the left of long leg to get off the pair
tossed up very full outside off, jams down on it and keeps it out

now Ishant gives Moeen the charge, and why not. Why not if you can get right to the pitch of it and launch it with the turn over wide mid-on? Finishes classically with his bat over his left shoulder, and Kohli punches the air in the dressing room
tossed up wide of off, looks for the sweep and misses, is hit on the back thigh
sharp turn from outside off as Ishant goes deep in his crease. Lbw for sure if he missed this, but he manages to middle this flick through backward square leg
tossed up slow on middle and leg, big stretch out to block it back to the bowler
flat, keeps going with the angle outside off, goes deep in his crease to defend towards slip with an open face
starts with a long-hop, and he goes back and across to pull to the left of deep square leg
full on middle and off, big stride out to smother it
tossed up slow on off stump, looks to get forward and work it with the angle, and the leading edge rolls into the covers

taken, excellent catch from the fielder running to his left from backward square leg. Tossed up a bit slower, and Ishant looks to sweep from just outside off. Too far from the pitch of the ball to control it, and Stone runs to his left and finishes with a slide as he gets under the top edge
wow. That's marginally short, straightens towards middle stump, and he rocks back, opens up at the hip, and absolutely hammers a pull to the left of midwicket. Superb shot
smartly done. Makes room against a slightly back-of-length ball on the stumps to dab it wide of slip. He could have run two, but he takes just one to keep the strike
stretches out to defend one tossed up outside off, and it turns and bounces to hit him on the chest. May have hit the flap of the pad too
quicker, on off stump, goes right back to defend into the point region
back of a length, straightens slightly towards off stump, goes back to punch it back to the bowler
looks to sweep from outside off, maybe a touch too full. Bottom edge squeezes through to the right of the keeper

goes for the sweep again, and he just manages to elude deep square leg running to his right. It's in the air, but mostly off the middle of the bat, and the fielder puts in a dive, but he can't quite reach it on the full. Manages to palm it away into the boundary. Broad the fielder.
looks for the reverse-sweep from outside off, rolls back to the left of the bowler off the toe end
tossed up, ripping away with extra bounce from middle stump. Easily past the edge as he gets forward to defend
goes on the back foot this time, defends from an off-stump line, back to the bowler
goes back to a slightly fuller one spinning from middle to off, defends with the turn
quick turn away from off stump. Goes back to defend and it zips past his edge. Bat came down at an angle, slicing across the line
and again, past the edge with a quick length ball spinning away from off stump. Goes right back to defend, can't get near it

full, on middle and leg. Squeezes it back to the bowler off the outside half of the bat. Again his bat came down at that angle, and he could easily have gotten a bigger leading edge on it. But he's done brilliantly to survive the over
quickish outside off, gets back to dab with an open face to the right of slip
wow, nearly drags it on. Pitches on or outside leg stump, and Ashwin is through his reverse-sweep too quickly. Bottom edges into the ground, and it bounces over the stumps and beats Foakes as well
length ball slanting across and straightening towards off stump, goes right back to defend it back to the bowler
on the back foot again, defends this one spinning on from outside off, and does so comfortably, towards silly point
tossed up fuller, and it spins past the inside edge of his forward defensive to hit the thigh pad. Extra bounce too, so no appeal, and it struck him outside the line
a touch shorter, and he goes right back to defend to silly point. The turn is slow enough for him to play these comfortably off the back foot
tossed up full close to off stump, blocked to short extra-cover
sharp turn and bounce from an off-stump line, and Ashwin's feet don't go anywhere. Pushes at it and the ball rips past his edge. Excellent length
now it's delivered a bit slower outside off, and he gets the stretch out to defend into the covers
tossed up full on off stump, driven smoothly past the bowler, to the left of long-on. Doesn't take the single, hmmm.

shot. Superb shot. That's a length ball spinning away from off stump, and he rocks back and make room to cut it to the right of backward point. One of the shots of the innings. His back foot is so deep in the crease when he hits it
tossed up, angling into leg stump, stretches across and sweeps firmly, but short fine leg is there to cut off the single

tossed up wide of off, and Siraj gets the single. Stretches out to defend to the left of short cover, and Ashwin sets off immediately. Siraj takes an age to respond, but they still complete the run with ease
floated up full on off stump, driven to mid-off
wow. Tossed up on off stump, and he clears his front leg, sinks back on his back knee, and slog-sweeps this with a sweet, sweet clunk off the bat, easily clears the midwicket boundary
flighted full-toss on middle and leg, driven inside-out to the left of long-off, far enough from the fielder to run two and move to 99. Chepauk explodes in a chorus of whistles

edged for four, and what an innings this has been! Fifth Test hundred, and it's such a catartic moment for a man who went through a genuine batting trough for two years. That innings in Sydney has rejuvenated his batting once again. Steps out to the flighted ball outside off, has a big slog at it, and the edge flies wide of slip and runs away for four. He punches the air, and Siraj punches the air with even more fervour at the non-striker's end

more lucky runs, and the lead grows and grows. Looks to sweep from outside off, and he doesn't connect cleanly. Either the bottom edge or a bit of pad - impact would have been well outside off - and it runs away to the left of the keeper, very fine
tossed up outside off, and Siraj can have fun now. Clears his front leg and slogs it away, not middled, but into a gap somewhere in the square leg region.
goes right back to one straightening just outside off, defends solidly into the point region
what a shot. Straight bat too! Not a half-volley, on off stump, and he leans forward and extends his arms through a straight drive to launch it high over the bowler's head
bounce, from a middle-stump line. Goes on the back foot and tries to fend it away, hits the bat handle and falls just short of Pope diving forward from short leg
tossed up outside off, stretches out to defend to short cover

down the track, and that's dropped. Difficult chance, got right to the pitch and flicked this firmly in the air, from just outside off. Root throws himself to his left at midwicket, gets both hands to it, but can't wrap his fingers around it
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers
stand and deliver. Fullish, a bit of width, and he just leans back and drives powerfully, but short cover dives left to stop it
full-toss on off stump, hip high, pulled to deep square leg. Doesn't take the single
short, just outside off, clears that front leg and plays another straight tennis pull, to mid-on
length ball on off stump, makes a bit of room by moving his front leg away from the line, and punches to mid-off
short outside off, again he pulls firmly down the ground, but can't beat mid-on
goes back to a length ball straightening just outside off, defends with the turn
down the track, can't get to the pitch of this one spinning away from off stump, and stretches out to prod it to the left of extra-cover
looks to pad away a ball pitching outside leg, and it hits his back shin and ricochets onto the helmet behind the keeper. India don't get five runs, because he didn't offer a shot
back of a length, turning from outside leg, goes back and works it to the right of midwicket
wham. Tossed up, stump-to-stump line, and he clears his front leg, sinks down on his back knee, and slog-sweeps powerfully over midwicket
full, close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length, keeps a little low, close to off stump. Stays leg-side of the ball, looks to punch through the covers, and the ball sneaks past his inside edge
back of a length outside off, punched to the left of mid-off
short, plenty of width, slapped to the right of deep point
full, just outside off, clears his front leg and looks to swipe it straight of mid-on. Doesn't quite middle it and the fielder can cut it off

bowled him. Back of a length, fairly close to off stump, and Ashwin was looking to go after pretty much every ball now. Looks to open up and pull, and he bottom-edges into the top of off stump. The end of a special, special innings, and he raises his bat to the crowd as he walks off
full inswinger, but Ishant strays on the pads. Burns has this tendency to shuffle across, but this time he picks it up and flicks it uppishly. The ball pings the square-leg fence
uppish drive to follow the uppish flick. Full and wide outside off, Ishant has the opening batsman reaching out for the ball. Carved away between point and covers
Ishant slightly pulls his length back and gets this to swerve into middle and straighten away late, Burns shuffles across once again and is hit high on the thigh pad. Not quite threatening the stumps
very full and veering down the leg side, away from the reach of the flick. Burns seems to be on the move while meeting the ball
full and outside off, Burns reaches out, plays away from the body and slices it to point
on a length and simply comes back in with the angle, but does not pose a threat to off stump. So, Burns watches it through to the keeper
quick turn for Axar, fizzes past the outside edge. Big splash from the surface as it spins past the outside edge
on a length and slides into middle, clipped away off the back foot to short fine leg
full and darted in on middle, forward and played back to the bowler
length ball, starts outside off and rips away with extra bounce. Good take from Pant. Left alone
threatens to drift in from wide of the crease, but grips and bounces past the front-foot prod of Sibley
slower and sliding in at off stump, this full ball is watchfully defended on off stump. Axar begins with a maiden
full and straightens a little outside off, Burns opens the bat-face and defensively pushes to that man at short point
full and swinging into middle, Burns covers up for it and taps it down to mid-on
on a length and slanting in at off, Burns ventures forward and across as he defensively drops the ball to the leg side
Ishant tests Burns with a short delivery angling into his body. Burns aims for the pull but the ball doesn't quite come onto him. Toe-ends it away to the slip cordon
on a length and sliding in from outside off, nothing doing from Burns
on a length and outside off, blocked to the covers off the front foot
on a length, doesn't turn in, instead seems to swerve away past the outside edge
fractionally short and spins in to the stumps, Sibley gets inside the line and whips it away to deep square leg
looped up on middle stump, Sibley uses his big reach to smother the ball
dips into a length on off, Sibely has a short little stride and edges it to the covers
on a length and breaks in on middle, Sibley tightens up by going right back in defence
shorter and skidding in towards the fourth-stump line with some extra bounce. Sibley diffuses it off the back foot
pushed through on off, Burns is forward to defend it back
full and drifting into the pads, neatly flicked through square leg, with head over the ball
Axar hangs it up in the air, full, drops on off. Sibley stretches out to dead-bat it away
wide of the crease, slides on outside off, Sibley judges it well and lets it pass in the channel
tossed up on a fourth-stump line, Sibley loosens his grip and defends with soft hands
darted flatter and quicker on off, this doesn't turn, looks like natural variation. Blocked to the leg side off the back foot
pushed through outside off, spins away, no shot
looped up on middle, full, Burns is forward to push it back to Ashwin

Dropped by Pant! drifts in from around the wicket and spins away outside off, Burns inches forward, pokes at it, feathers it behind to Pant, who can't get his gloves around the ball. That will go down as a dropped chance. This delivery disturned the surface as well
pushed through on middle and spins in, prodded to the right of short leg
some positive intent from Burns and the reward for it is a boundary. Pushed through on middle, down the track and driven firmly to the left of Ashwin and right of mid-on
the down-the-track hit has made Ashwin shorten his length, picked off the hips through square leg
on a length, rips away and bounces from an off-stump line, beaten in the channel
tossed up on middle, non-turner, which is blocked to the leg side
round-arm dart from Axar, too full on off stump, defensively stabbed away to the leg side
Sibley presses forward to blunt this full delivery sliding in at off stump
a bit too full and outside off, jabbed away, silly-point is in the way
another round-arm dart from Axar, fired on off, kept out
pushed through and straightens along middle stump, Burns plays it back with a straight bat
drifting into the pads, Burns aims for a sweep, ends up tickling it to short fine leg
flatter and fuller on off stump, Burns has a decent stride, pushing back to Ashwin
down the track, Burns doesn't get close enough to the pitch, but adjusts and plays it back to Ashwin
quick turn and bounce, so difficult to handle this combination on this pitch. On a length and rips away past the outside edge
slightly fuller and outside off, Burns opens the face and dinks the ball to point
tossed up just a shade outside off, some extra bounce for Axar, Sibley loosens his grip to absorb it and defend

arm ball from Axar Patel, round-arm, fizzes in to ping the back pad right in front of middle. Sibley is hurried into a defence. He was looking to play it through midwicket, but couldn't get any bat onto it in the end. Looks pretty plumb and there's the first wicket for India in the fourth innings. It would have crashed into the middle of middle stump
on a length and snaking in once again, cramps the new man for room. Lawrence may have inside edged it onto his pad
Lawrence hangs his bat inside the line as this full ball slides on just outside off
full and sliding into middle, Lawrence elects to play back and squirts it out
on a length and slides in at off, Lawrence goes back and confidently blocks it to the off side
turn and bounces past Burns' attempt to slash it away off the back foot
on a length and drifts into middle, worked away to backward square leg
quicker, flatter, heading down the leg side. Burns tickles it away fine to find the boundary
tossed up on middle, down the track and driven to mid-on
pushed through fuller and wider of off, Burns stretches out, sinks on his back knee, and sweeps it flat and hard to the square-leg boundary
on a length and slides in on middle, Lawrence dares to step out and whip it over the top against the spin. Pumped over midwicket for four. More positive intent from England
full and speared in at off, forward and defensively patted into the covers
Lawrence ventures down the track once again, on a length, he doesn't get close enough to the pitch. He chips it in the air to the right of mid-on
shorter and spins away a wee bit outside off, Lawrence now jumps back and jabs it wide of silly point
turn and bounce outside off, Lawrence hangs his bat inside the line and doesn't go searching for it
quickish length ball, angling in and spinning away viciously. A crease-bound Lawrence wafts and misses
whoa! Quick turn for Ashwin from a middle-stump line, so Burns pushes out and it rips away past the outside edge
full on the stumps, Burns stretches out and drives to mid-on
shortish and spins away outside off, Burns goes back and plays it back to the bowler
looped up and spins away outside off, Burns uses his feet, but doesn't get close to the pitch. He chips a drive to the left of mid-off and rushes across to the other end
Lawrence steps out a bit early, Ashwin slows this up and pulls his length back. Lawrence adjusts and wafts it to the leg side
tossed up on the leg stump and spinning down the leg side with vicious bounce. Beats the batsman, beats Pant, and rolls away into the boundary
full and spins into off stump, poked into the covers
on a length, spins in and bounces from outside off, Burns jabs it to the right of short leg
