Burns stretches out, and confidently sweeps a middle-stump delivery to deep square leg
slides in at off stump, round-arm dart from Axar, Lawrence inches forward and seems to have inside-edged onto his pad
Lawrence uses his feet, flat and quick, prodded to mid-off
tossed up slower and just a shade outside off, drags Lawrence forward into a drive, he throws his hands at it, and inside-edges it away past the leg stump
on a length on middle, drifts away to square up Lawrence to snag the outside edge. Rahane makes a smart diving save to his right from slip
tossed up on off, Lawrence defends off the front foot
pushed through and straightens along an off-stump line, played back to Ashwin off the front foot
a bit too full for the sweep, Lawrence takes it from the stumps and hauls it to midwicket
Ashwin pushes this through on middle, Lawrence dashes down the track, is close to the pitch this time. He extends his hands and launches it with the intended break over mid-on
flatter and on middle and leg stump, Lawrence stays still in his crease and defensively taps the ball to short midwicket
skidding into a middle-stump line from around the stumps, whisked away through square leg
flighted and spins away a wee bit outside off, Lawrence is forward again to drive. Silly-point is in the way
on a length and sliding in, smart footwork from Lawrence again: he's right back to block it to the leg side
quicker and spins from an off-stump line, zips past the outside edge as Lawrence plays inside the line
fuller on middle and leg, Lawrence camps back and nudges a single into the midwicket region
back of a length and straightens around middle-stump line, Burns blocks off the back foot
tossed up, full and pops up to beat the inside edge and strike the thigh pad
on a length and spins in, nudged towards midwicket
really full and outside off, slower as well, stabbed defensively to the covers
down the track and punches a middle-stump delivery down to long-on
full and pushed through on middle, patted down the ground

edged and grabbed at slip. Ashwin loops it up into off stump, dips nicely too. Burns closes his bat-face and eyes up the leg side. Instead, he nicks it off to Kohli at second slip. Good overhead catch. The Ashwin show rolls on at Chepauk
full on middle, down the track and pushed to mid-on
on a length and outside off, defended
turns and bounces from an off-stumpish line and beats the outside edge. Pant is beaten as well
on a length and outside off, defended

Caught at leg slip! The nightwatchman is gone for a duck. Fullish, spins in and bounces from over the wicket, disturbs the surface. Leach has a feeble prod at it and loops it to Rohit. Two wickets in a space of seven balls just before stumps
tossed up outside off and spins in, down the track and whisked down the ground
full and spinning into middle, Root elects to play back and works it through square leg
Ashwin lobs it up outside off, Lawrence uses his feet, but the ball spins viciously past his bat, hitting the pad and looping to leg slip. Another big splash from the surface
Ashwin held this back on off, forward and blocked
full on middle, Lawrence stretches out to sweep. Gill at short leg takes evasive action and cops a painful blow on his left hand

India think they have their man. Pant thinks there's an edge, so they go for a caught-behind review. Full and fizzes in from around the wicket towards the off stump. Root plays back as opposed to pressing forward and jabs his bat down. Ultra Edge suggests there's no bat involved. They check for the lbw as well. Seems like struck in front of off, ball-tracking, though, suggests umpire's call on impact. Root survives by a few millimeters. It had been given not out originally by umpire Menon, although for caught behind, and that will stay. Kohli is peeved and has an intense chat with Menon
on a length and slides in from around the wicket to hit the pad
on a length and spins sharply past the outside edge
worked off the pads through square leg
shorter on off, punched into the covers
back of a length, angling down leg, can't connect with the flick off the hip
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended towards mid-on
short, rising to chest height over middle and off, gets back and across, gets his head to the off side of the ball, and hooks it down to long leg
lovely delivery, angling into the corridor, lovely seam position, and straightens off the pitch. Lawrence has a poke at it and misses
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
fullish, close to off stump, presses forward but is a little late getting there. Straightens a touch, and he defends with soft hands so the edge rolls away along the floor, wide of gully
past the edge first ball. Angled in towards off stump with that round-arm action, draws Root forward to defend and rips it across the face of his bat with an explosion off the pitch
and again. This one pitches slightly further outside off and turns slightly less, but same result
fuller, defended into the off side
a touch shorter and straighter, not too much turn, goes back to work it through square leg
angled in, fairly full close to off stump, gets forward to defend with the angle, into the on side
quickish length ball close to off stump, stays leg-side of it to defend into the cover point region
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length on middle stump, gets back and across to defend into the on side

back of a length, angling into off stump, and this one jumps at Root. Does very well to get his bottom hand off the handle and keep the ball down in front of midwicket. Comes off the shoulder of the bat. India should think of putting in a short leg
back of a length on off stump, back and across to defend into the on side, off the inside half of the bat
full, angling down leg, can't connect with the flick
nicely bowled, a bit of shape in from just back of a length, towards off stump, gets right behind it and defends it back to the bowler
tossed up close to off stump, stretches out and drives with an open face through point
sharp turn, quick turn, from a good length outside off. Not far enough forward to defend, his foot has just landed on its heel, and the ball rips past his outside edge
a touch shorter, on middle stump, goes back and works it towards mid-on
beauty. This one's angling in a long way with that round-arm release. It pitches on off stump and turns absolutely square. Root looks to defend off the back foot and can't put bat anywhere near ball
ooh, now looks to sweep from outside off - the shot that got him out in the first innings, off the same bowler - and the ball spins away to beat him again
good use of the depth of the crease. This one goes with the angle towards middle and leg, and he steps back to work it through square leg
length ball angling into off stump, defended to short extra-cover
length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and defends close to his body, with soft hands, and it rolls away off the face of his bat towards gully
back of a length on off stump, punched back past the bowler and mid-off chases back to cut it off

big appeal for lbw, big reverse from Siraj there and he slips in the full one after banging away on a length or just shorter for two overs. Lawrence falls over while trying to flick, and luckily for him he gets a thick inside edge onto his pad
length ball shaping in towards middle and leg, clipped to the right of short leg
goes full again, ends up a touch too straight, clipped down to long leg off the toes
tossed up full on off stump, gets forward to block with an open face to backward point
quick slider going towards middle and leg, goes right back to work it through square leg
quickish and full close to off stump, defended back to the bowler
a bit slower and wider, gets a stride forward to defend back down the pitch. He tends to play with a slightly closed face in defence
looks to step out and he fires one into his pads. Adjusts to clip to midwicket

looks to step out again and Axar bowls this outside off. Gets a touch too close to the pitch of the ball, maybe, and perhaps the ball also stops on him. Ends up spooning his checked drive in the air, but it falls short of - and slightly wide of - mid-off, to his left

got him, that's smartly bowled, and great work behind the stumps too! Lawrence steps out too early, and Ashwin fires in a quick offbreak that spins between his legs as he misses the hurried flick. The turn takes Pant a long way down the leg side to collect the ball, and from there he throws himself to his right to complete the stumping
goes back to a quickish length ball turning away from off stump, blocked to silly point
quickish again, fuller and on middle and leg. Defended with the turn to silly point
flat, mostly goes with the angle towards middle stump, clipped watchfully into the on side

great change of pace. Tossed up slower, lands it on off stump, and Stokes' tendency to play with his front pad sliding away from the line of the ball again gets him in trouble. Ends up defending a long way inside the line of the ball as this turns and bounces and beats the keeper as well
quickish length ball on off stump, goes back and punches into the point region
length ball spinning away outside off, left alone
quick slider targeting middle and off, goes back to defend with the angle, into the on side
goes for the sweep, and he picks the right line and length for it, from outside off to deep square leg
fired in, pitching on the stumps and turning down leg. Stokes lifts his bat up and simply offers pad
tossed up slower and wider outside off, swept to deep backward square leg
Root sweeps again, from pretty close to off stump, this time he gets his pad away from the line of the ball to play his trademark sweep in front of square, out to the midwicket boundary

top-edged sweep, looks to play the shot from a leg-stumpish line but the length is slightly on the shorter side to play it safely, given the bounce. Loops up in the air, but well to the left of Pujara at short fine leg
tossed up wide of off stump, reaches out and sweeps to deep forward square leg, who's out there just for this shot
looks to step out and Ashwin bowls a quicker one, pulls his length back a bit and attacks the stumps. Stretches out and blocks it back where it came from
a bit slower, more middle-and-leg in line, and Stokes gets his pad out of the way and blocks it back
square turn from the line of the stumps, lots of bounce, and Pant takes it very well, over his left shoulder with both gloves, after Stokes is squared up and beaten
tossed up slower outside off, big stretch out to smother it
fullish, straightening towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
full, a bit more turn from off stump, gets a good stride forward to defend into the covers
ooh, goes back to one that just slides on with the angle, a lot of zip off the pitch. Jams his bat down and keeps it from hitting his off and middle stumps
a touch shorter, so he can go safely back. Straightens towards off stump and he works it away through square leg
quick, spinning in from outside off, presses forward and blocks it back
sweeps, from just outside off to deep backward square leg. Did well to get that stretch forward because Axar bowled this pretty quick
back of a length, turning towards off stimp, makes room to cut and chops it down into the pitch
fuller, on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
quickish, pitching outside leg and spinning into the stumps, defends with pad as a line of defence, and it spins just enough to hit it

looks to sweep, and misses. Not the most enthusiastic lbw appeal. It must have pitched outside leg. Nicely bowled, a bit slower, and it dips on Stokes a little. Pitched just outside leg, and it may have bounced over the stumps too
a bit slower, pitching just outside leg, brings out the reverse-sweep to the right of backward point

so dangerous. Strides all the way across to expose all his stumps and look for the lap-sweep from the line of the stumps. Hits the face of his bat, then his forearm, and then loops up over the man at leg gully
length ball straightening towards middle and leg, defended into the on side
sharp turn, goes slightly down leg, misses the flick and it hits his thigh pad and runs away fine. Or was there some bat on it? No signal of leg-byes
tossed up fairly full on leg stump, swept to the left of deep backward square leg
slider, keeps a bit low as it comes in towards middle stump, goes back and keeps his eye on it and blocks it back with a straight bat
quickish, attacking the stumps, goes back to clip watchfully into the on side
back of a length, turning away from off stump with a bit of bounce, stabbed to backward point

and there's a possible run-out first ball! Nah, he's made it back in. Stokes gets forward to push to the left of Axar at extra-cover, and they think of the quick single. Root has to turn back hurriedly and there's a direct hit at the non-striker's end, but he's safe.
tossed up on off stump, big stretch out to defend
tossed up slow around off stump, spins sharply to beat the forward defensive
quicker again, angling into the stumps, goes back to clip into the leg side
tossed up wider outside off, driven to extra-cover with a turn of the wrists to keep it down
goes right back to defend a quicker one on off stump

interesting shot. Gets down a little early to sweep, a bit of premeditation, and the ball is shorter than he expects, around middle and leg, and he plays a half-pull, half-sweep through backward square leg
sharp turn to beat the forward defensive. Axar goes even more round-arm than normal, and turns it from a middle-stump line. Unplayable
now he turns it from slightly fuller on off stump, and Root, getting forward, defends with soft hands and half-controls it wide of gully. Hit the high part of the edge
tossed up slower on a similar line and length, he has time to get a big stretch forward to sweep through square leg
floated across to middle and off, swept to deep backward square leg
finds the edge again, a bit of turn from an off-stump line. Gets a good stride forward to defend, and cushions it with soft hands so the ball lands well short of Kohli at gully
tossed up on leg stump from over the wicket, defended with soft hands with the turn
quick length ball, angling into middle and off and ripping away massively to beat the forward defensive. Excellent take from Pant, made it look easy
goes back to a quickish length ball spinning towards the stumps from outside leg, defends it right under his eyes
big slog and miss. Floated this up wide of off and full. Was a full-toss when he missed it, possibly the carrom ball
length ball on the pads, defended into the on side
turn and bounce outside off, left alone
full on off stump, defended towards mid-on
reverse-swing in towards the stumps. Full length, draws Root forward to defend, and he gets a thick inside edge into his front pad
full, close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
fullish, a bit of shape in towards off stump, blocked into the covers
full, angling into middle and leg, clipped to short midwicket. Pujara has a shy at the stumps, hoping to catch Root out of his crease, but he's quickly in, and there's no direct hit anyway
well played. This one is bowled with the shiny side out and it straightens late towards off stump. Excellent length too. Gets back and across and defends into the covers
tossed up slow outside leg, pads it away
full, quicker this time, turning from leg stump. Good stride forward to defend into the off side
sharp turn and bounce from outside leg, beats Stokes' attempt to pad it away, and again Pant makes a difficult take, over his left shoulder, look straightforward
fuller, on leg stump, defended back to the bowler
quick length ball spinning away from the stumps, left alone. Exposed all his stumps while doing so
and immediately the carrom ball. Pitching on off stump and turning back in with extra bounce. Squeezes past the inside edge to hit the flap of the pad as he comes forward to defend
good length and tails in towards off stump, Root stabs at the ball as inside edge sneaks away through square leg
very full on middle, Stokes elects to play back and squirts it to the covers
on a length and swinging down the leg side, no shot from Stokes. Easier take for Pant
mighty full and bending in at off stump once again, jabbed back to Ishant
again pretty full on off, Stokes keeps it out
full on middle, Stokes camps back, covers up and plays it back to Ishant
flighted on middle stump, Root presses forward and clips smartly to midwicket
shorter and spins away outside off, Stokes goes back and punches firmly, silly-point is in the way and saves it
shorter and spins away outside off once again, another back-foot punch, silly-point collects it to his right
much fuller and flatter on off, Stokes digs it out to silly-point
back of a length and slides in from around the wicket, Stokes can't put it away as he takes it on the pad

this is much fuller, slides in from around the wicket, as opposed to turning away once again. A crease-bound Stokes prods at the ball, playing for turn, inside-edged onto the pad, and it loops behind to Kohli, who dives forward to grab the ball at second slip, throwing himself in front of first. Ashwin gets Stokes once again. India are five away from victory
near-yorker length ball, homing in on off, jammed out
on a length and largely holds its line outside off, guided to point
full and probing away outside off, moves away like a legcutter. Root thinks about having a crack at it before pulling his bat inside the line
very full and curling into middle, chipped away through midwicket
on a length and plugging away outside off, left alone
full and nipping into leg stump, deflected away through the leg side
pushed through on middle, full enough for the sweep/reverse-sweep. Root stretches out and drills a reverse-sweep through point
Ashwin pushes it through quicker and shortens his length outside off, swept to leg slip
reverse-swept from the stumps again, but this time struck straight to point
pushed through on off stump, Root opens the face and dabs it through the cover-point region
tossed up and spins in from outside off, played back to Ashwin
tip and run to the covers as Pope retains the strike
on a length and outside off, Ishant has Pope reaching out for the ball as this holds its line in the channel. He opens the bat-face and runs it behind point
on a length and homing in at off stump, Pope gets forward and defensively pushes to cover
fullish and holds its line outside off, Pope reaches out again, poking to the right of gully off the outer half
full and on a fourth-stump line, defended to cover off the front foot
very full and on the pads, chipped in front of shortish square leg. There are two other close-in catchers on the leg side
on a length and outside off, Pope taps to cover off the front foot and cries 'wait on'
full and spins in on middle, Root shuffles across and sweeps confidently to long leg
fired on middle from around the wicket. Pope stretches out, rolls out a reverse-sweep and gets it past point. Pujara chases back and cuts it off to two
looped up and spins in on middle, defended with soft hands to leg slip
Pope jumps out and jabs an off-stumpish ball towards point
carrom ball? Pushed through quicker on middle, defended to short leg
Pope stretches out, meets this middle-stump delivery on the full and hauls it away to deep midwicket with a sweep
starts off with a stock ball that spins in, but is too short, allowing Pope to go back and whip it through square leg

full and spins in sharply against the angle from left-arm over to beat Root's attempt to reverse-sweep it away. Not given out lbw. India don't review either as this is surely heading down the leg side
looped up on leg stump, worked to the right of short leg
pitches on middle stump, big splash from the surface, and spins down the leg side
pushed through on off, forward and guided through the cover-point region
dropped short on middle stump, slower turn, Pope goes on the back foot and pulls it away to long leg
round-arm release, flat dart, holds up in the pitch. Pope spoons it in front of the bowler
Axar drags his length back, jabbed to mid-off
on a length and slides in with the angle from around the wicket, nudged defensively behind square
flatter and quicker, Pope plays for the incoming angle, but it spins away, misses the off stump by a whisker and pops out of Pant's gloves

pushed through on off stump, full and a hint of extra bounce as another ball disturbs the surface. Pope ventures a slog-sweep and ends up splicing it to Ishant at deep midwicket. He runs in and completes a straightforward catch. England continue to stutter around Root. India are four away from victory
slides in from a round-arm release, back of length, glanced away behind square off the back foot
reverse-swept from a middle-stump line to point
full and slower on the stumps, blocked off the front foot
fuller and spins into middle, defended to where short leg may have been
on a length and spins in, Root aims for another reverse-sweep, does not make contact, and is hit on the pad, but this seems to be sliding past leg stump
dragged down on middle, slower, Root has ample time to jump back and pull it away behind square
looped up on middle and sliding away with the angle from left-arm over, blocked to the covers
sliding in with the angle, flat and quick, blocked on off stump
sliding in once again from a round-arm release, clipped through the gap at midwicket off the back foot
tossed up just a shade outside off, Foakes gets forward and plays it back to Axar
on a length, pitches just a shade outside off and rags away in the channel to beat the outside edge. Pant rides the bounce and takes it superbly, stretching to his right
more turn and bounce but not as sharp as the last ball, diffused to silly point
a bit too full on off, dead-batted away
tossed up, spins in at middle, Root stretches out to smother the spin

Root top-edges a reverse-sweep and it's dropped by Siraj! Pushed through and spins in on middle, dips and bounces, even as Root stretches out. He splices it in the air. Siraj moves across to his right from backward point, dives, and shells it
on a length, pitches on middle, and spins down the leg side
tossed on middle, driven down to long-on
overpitched and outside off, driven through the line through the covers
round-arm dart from Axar, shoots low, Root plays back to it and is struck on the pad, but it seems to be missing leg stump with that sharp angle
slides on outside off as opposed to coming in with the angle from around the wicket. Root hangs his bat inside the line as the ball passes the bat
on a length and rips away outside off, Root plays inside the line and allows himself to be beaten in the channel. Rapid turn for Axar
tossed up on off, Root bends forward and defends to silly-point
darted in on off stump, Root lunges forward in defence
lobbed up outside off, dips sharply and spins away to beat Root's sweep. Pant rides the bounce and takes it superbly
fuller and skidding in, Foakes plays back and stabs to the right of midwicket
looped up and spins in at off, Foakes is forward and across to block it on middle stump

lobbed in the air, miscued straight to midwicket, where Axar takes a regulation catch. Some joy finally for Kuldeep and Chepauk celebrates with him. On middle, but a bit too full for the sweep, so Foakes can't quite get hold of that shot, and mishits it to Axar
length ball outside off, not too much turn but plenty of bounce, left alone
nice length, spinning away from off stump, presses forward to block with the turn into the cover point region
ooh, turn and bounce and Kuldeep finds the edge, but it bounces over the jumping Rohit at gully. Comes forward to defend one pitching around off stump, and it lobs up off the shoulder of the bat
slows it down, close to off stump, Root comes forward to defend and the ball rips past his outside edge

gone this time. Similar line and length to the previous one, possibly slightly wider to start, and Root comes forward to defend, but this one leaps from the pitch and hits his glove, lobs to Rahane for a simple catch at slip. Root looks ruefully at the spot that the ball turned from before trudging off the field
past the edge again. Quick length ball spinning away from off stump, and he's beaten looking to defend off the back foot
and again. Gets half a stride forward this time to defend, but the ball turns too sharply and too quickly once again
back of a length, goes with the angle towards off stump, punched off the back foot into the point region
length ball angling into the stumps, not too much turn, defended into the on side
short outside off, shapes to cut, but it turns too sharply, and keeps a little low too, so he checks himself and leaves it
nearly every ball is turning square now. Goes back to this off-stump ball, and he sees the extent of turn away and leaves it alone
into the stands. Down the track when he sees a bit of flight on leg stump, gets his feet inside the line and launches it high over the long-on boundary
tossed up full on middle stump, defended with the turn to silly point
sharp turn away from off stump, excellent length, left alone
short, wide, cut away to the right of cover point

all three of those fielders are there for the turning ball, but this one doesn't turn as he looks to sweep from one that's on or around off stump. Risky. He misses, and the ball hits his thigh pad. Given out on the field, and Stone has reviewed... No bat. Did that strike him in line? Umpire's call on impact, and the ball is going on to hit off stump. India are one wicket away now. And Axar has a five-for on debut. What a moment for him!
looks to sweep a quick one from just outside off. Sharp turn to beat him and hit the pad, but it's probably spinning too much to hit the stumps. Barely had time to get down properly to sweep that
quick turn from outside off as he hangs back to defend. Off the inside edge into the square leg region
steps out and smokes another six over long-on. Tossed up outside off, a puff of dust when the ball hits the surface, but Moeen gets into a great position to launch it handsomely with the turn

replay. Axar is looking to hit one of many rough patches outside off stump, and Moeen steps out and gets into just the right position again, close enough to the pitch of the ball to be able to negotiate the turn, but just far enough from it to create swinging room and get the elevation he wants
tosses it up wider, and Moeen jumps out, uses the extra room, and hits it straight back over the bowler's head. Stunning hit
shot! Every now and then he'll play a shot that reminds you of the old allrounder days. A touch overpitched outside off, and he gets a big stride forward to drive to the left of cover point
tossed up, spinning away from off stump, Broad misses the sweep
wrong'un, not too much turn from just outside off. Presses forward and blocks square on the off side
looks to sweep one spinning into the stumps from outside leg, misses and is hit on the pad
full on off stump, blocked to short extra-cover
tossed up slow close to off stump. Presses forward to defend and the ball rolls into the square leg region off the inside edge
quickish length ball spinning from leg stump after angling in from around the wicket. Defended back towards the bowler
steps out, looks to hit Ashwin out of the park, but it's much harder when it's spinning away. Doesn't get to the pitch of it but he manages to skew it over mid-off
six more! Tossed up a bit wider, and he gets down quickly to sweep it over the forward square leg boundary
length ball on leg stump, swept to the left of Kuldeep at deep square leg
flat, angling into the pads, looks to come forward and flick, doesn't turn and hits his pad
quick arm ball skidding into the left-hander as he comes forward to defend. Polite appeal from Pant, but there may have been an inside edge. Possibly going down leg too
tossed up outside off, steps up and makes room to drive that inside-out through cover. Superb use of the wrists there, drills it between short extra-cover and cover point

got him, and Rishabh Pant ends this Test match with another acrobatic stumping. This was coming. Steps out once again, and Kuldeep dangles it up slower and wider. Doesn't reach the pitch of it, and it turns too far from him to be able to reach with another attempted drive. Pant has to catch it with his arms extended fully to the left, and from there he dives towards the stumps to end the Test match
